sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: digital
trans: n. 数字；键

sentences.english: digital TV
sentences.chinese: 数字电视

sentences.english: a digital signal
sentences.chinese: 数字信号

sentences.english: a digital camera
sentences.chinese: 数码照相机

sentences.english: digital recording
sentences.chinese: 数字录音

detailed_translations.english: using a system in which information is recorded or sent out electronically in the form of numbers, usually ones and zeros

name: direct
trans: adj. 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: directly
trans: conj. 一…就

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: direction
trans: n. 方向；指导；趋势；用法说明

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: discussion
trans: n. 讨论，议论

sentences.english: class discussions
sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

name: discuss
trans: vt. 讨论；论述，辩论

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

name: distinguish
trans: vi. 区别，区分；辨别

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: distribute
trans: vt. 分配；散布；分开；把…分类

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: distribution
trans: n. 分布；分配

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: donate
trans: n. 捐赠；捐献

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: donation
trans: n. 捐款，捐赠物；捐赠

sentences.english: There have been generous donations from EU funds.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟基金给予了慷慨的捐款。

detailed_translations.english: something, especially money, that you give to a person or an organ-ization in order to help them

name: download
trans: vt. [计] 下载

sentences.english: games that can be downloaded free from the Internet
sentences.chinese: 可以从因特网上免费下载的游戏

detailed_translations.english: to move information or programs from a computer network to a small computer

name: dress
trans: n. 连衣裙；女装

sentences.english: a gentleman in evening dress
sentences.chinese: 穿晚礼服的绅士

sentences.english: The play was performed in modern dress (= clothes from the present time ) .
sentences.chinese: 这出戏里演员是现代装束。

detailed_translations.english: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion

name: drink
trans: n. 酒，饮料；喝酒

sentences.english: You should drink plenty of water.
sentences.chinese: 你应该大量喝水。

sentences.english: What would you like to drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝点什么？

sentences.english: Take a seat while I get you something to drink .
sentences.chinese: 请坐，我去给你倒杯喝的。

sentences.english: She filled the glass and drank.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子倒满后喝了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

trans: n. 驱动器；驾车；[心理] 内驱力，推进力；快车道

sentences.english: Can you drive?
sentences.chinese: 你会开车吗？

sentences.chinese: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。

sentences.english: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.chinese: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

detailed_translations.english: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

name: driver
trans: n. 驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器

sentences.english: a taxi driver
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机

sentences.english: Do you think you’re a good driver?
sentences.chinese: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who drives a car, bus etc

name: drop
trans: n. 滴；落下；空投；微量；滴剂

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

trans: n. 应付款；应得之物

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

trans: adj. 每；各自的

sentences.english: They reviewed each aspect of the plan bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 他们对计划的各个方面逐一地进行了审核。

name: early
trans: adj. 早期的；早熟的

sentences.english: We arrived early.
sentences.chinese: 我们提早到了。

sentences.english: They must have come home early.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定提早回到家了。

sentences.english: the early morning sunshine
sentences.chinese: 清晨的阳光

detailed_translations.english: before the usual, arranged, or expected time
in the first part of a period of time, event, or process

name: earth
trans: n. 地球；地表，陆地；土地，土壤；尘事，俗事；兽穴

sentences.english: the planet Earth
sentences.chinese: 地球

sentences.english: The earth shook.
sentences.chinese: 大地晃动了。

detailed_translations.english: the planet that we live on

name: easy
trans: adj. 容易的；舒适的

sentences.english: The test was easy.
sentences.chinese: 考试很容易。

sentences.english: Finishing the task will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.english: There must be an easier way to do that.
sentences.chinese: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

sentences.english: instructions that are easy to follow
sentences.chinese: 易于掌握的使用说明

sentences.english: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

sentences.english: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

sentences.english: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，爸爸过着安逸舒适的生活。

sentences.english: You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们都离开了家，你日子可以过得轻松了。

detailed_translations.english: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

name: easily
trans: adv. 容易地；无疑地

sentences.english: They won quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢得相当轻松。

sentences.english: We found the house easily enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们轻轻松松就找到了房子。

detailed_translations.english: without problems or difficulties

name: economy
trans: n. 经济；节约；理财

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: economist
trans: n. 经济学者；节俭的人

sentences.english: This led me, as a behavioral economist, to an intriguing hypothesis.
sentences.chinese: 这让我，作为一个行为经济学家，想到一个有趣的假设。

sentences.english: However, the economist cannot simply give those answers and leave it at that.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经济学家不能仅仅给出那样的答案就算了事。

sentences.english: Make sail: Define and explain an idea, it is economist commonly or Mr. MBA does.
sentences.chinese: 张帆： 定义和解释一个概念，一般是经济学家或者MBA老师做的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies the way in which money and goods are produced and used and the systems of business and trade

name: economic
trans: adj. 经济的，经济上的；经济学的

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

name: education
trans: n. 教育；培养；教育学

sentences.english: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
sentences.chinese: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。

sentences.english: efforts to improve girls’ access to education
sentences.chinese: 为增加女孩受教育机会所作的努力

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university

name: educate
trans: vt. 教育；培养；训练

sentences.english: The Ormerod School educates handicapped children.
sentences.chinese: 奥默罗德学校的教育对象为残疾儿童。

sentences.english: a campaign to educate teenagers about HIV
sentences.chinese: 教育青少年了解艾滋病病毒的运动

detailed_translations.english: to teach a child at a school, college, or university

name: educational
trans: adj. 教育的；有教育意义的

sentences.english: the educational development of children
sentences.chinese: 儿童的教育发展

detailed_translations.english: relating to education

name: effect
trans: n. 影响；效果；作用

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

name: effective
trans: adj. 有效的，起作用的；实际的，实在的；给人深刻印象

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: effectively
trans: adv. 有效地，生效地；有力地；实际上

sentences.english: Children have to learn to communicate effectively.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子应该学会有效地沟通。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that produces the result that was intended

name: embarrass
trans: vt. 使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: embarrassed
trans: v. 使...困窘；使...局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

name: else
trans: adj. 别的；其他的

sentences.english: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
sentences.chinese: 我还有其他事情要谈一谈。

sentences.english: I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
sentences.chinese: 我想请你过来，其他人有空也可以来。

sentences.english: He was awake now, as was everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他现在已经醒了，其他人也都醒了。

sentences.english: Who else was at the party?
sentences.chinese: 还有谁参加了聚会？

sentences.english: ‘Two coffees, please.’ ‘Anything else?’ ‘No, thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “请来两杯咖啡。”“还要别的吗？”“不要了，谢谢。

sentences.english: (= more than any other things ) she was seeking love.
sentences.chinese: 她追求爱情胜过一切。

sentences.english: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不能以画画谋生的话，至少我能教别人画画。

sentences.english: We had nothing else to do on those long trips.
sentences.chinese: 在那些漫长的旅途中我们别无他事可做。

detailed_translations.english: besides or in addition to someone or something
You use else after words such as "anywhere," "someone," and "what" to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励，怂恿；激励；支持

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: end
trans: n. 结束；目标；尽头；末端；死亡

sentences.english: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。

sentences.english: The end of the pencil snapped.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。

sentences.english: Jo joined the end of the line.
sentences.chinese: 乔排到了队尾。

sentences.english: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
sentences.chinese: 她为了实现自己的目标，什么都会去做。

sentences.english: The road ends here.
sentences.chinese: 这条路到此为止。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
to finish; to make sth finish

name: endless
trans: adj. 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的

sentences.english: an endless stream of visitors
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的游客

sentences.english: The possibilities are endless.
sentences.chinese: 有无限的可能性。

sentences.english: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
sentences.chinese: 他麻烦太多了——毒品、枪支、敲诈——说都说不完。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount, size, or number

name: endanger
trans: vt. 危及；使遭到危险

sentences.english: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enhancement
trans: n. 增加；放大

sentences.english: Progressive enhancement helps us to do that because it forces us to focus on the content and build out from there.
sentences.chinese: 渐进增强能够帮助我们做到这一点，因为它让我们关注内容并且从内容开始构建。

name: enjoy
trans: vt. 欣赏，享受；喜爱；使过得快活

sentences.english: We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我们在纽约的时间过得十分快活。

sentences.english: Thanks for a great evening. I really enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你这美好的晚会。我真的玩得很开心。

detailed_translations.english: to get pleasure from something

name: enjoyment
trans: n. 享受；乐趣；享有

sentences.english: Acting has brought me enormous enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 演戏给我带来莫大的快乐。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, a small minority want to spoil everyone else’s enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，少数几个人想令其他所有人扫兴。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of pleasure you get from having or doing something, or something you enjoy doing

name: enjoyable
trans: adj. 快乐的；有乐趣的；令人愉快的

sentences.english: Games can make learning more enjoyable.
sentences.chinese: 游戏可以寓教于乐。

sentences.english: an enjoyable experience
sentences.chinese: 令人愉快的经历

detailed_translations.chinese: 快乐的；有乐趣的；令人愉快的
detailed_translations.english: something enjoyable gives you pleasure

name: enter
trans: n. [计] 输入；回车

sentences.english: Knock before you enter.
sentences.chinese: 进来前先敲门。

sentences.english: The rebels were prepared to enter negotiations (= start discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

detailed_translations.english: to come or go into sth

name: entire
trans: adj. 全部的，整个的；全体的

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

name: entirely
trans: adv. 完全地，彻底地

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: entrance
trans: n. 入口；进入

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: environment
trans: n. 环境，外界

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: especially
trans: adv. 特别；尤其；格外

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

name: especial
trans: adj. 特殊的，特别的

sentences.english: Joyce took especial care to include her.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯特别留意把她加进来。

detailed_translations.english: Especial means unusual or special in some way

name: establish
trans: vi. 植物定植

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: establishment
trans: n. 确立，制定；公司；设施

sentences.english: the establishment of NATO in 1949
sentences.chinese: 1949年北约组织的建立

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

name: established
trans: adj. 确定的；已制定的，已建立的

name: even
trans: adj. [数] 偶数的；平坦的；相等的

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: eventually
trans: adv. 最后，终于

sentences.english: He eventually escaped and made his way back to England.
sentences.chinese: 他终于逃脱并返回英格兰。

sentences.english: Eventually, she got a job and moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 最终，她找到了工作并移居伦敦。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened

name: eventual
trans: adj. 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的

sentences.english: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。

sentences.english: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的
detailed_translations.english: happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened

name: ever
trans: adv. 永远；曾经；究竟

sentences.english: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
sentences.chinese: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 你去过巴黎吗？

sentences.english: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。

sentences.english: It was raining harder than ever.
sentences.chinese: 当时下着前所未有的大雨。

detailed_translations.english: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

name: evident
trans: adj. 明显的；明白的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: exact
trans: adj. 准确的，精密的；精确的

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: example
trans: n. 例子；榜样

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

name: excellent
trans: adj. 卓越的；极好的；杰出的

sentences.english: an excellent suggestion
sentences.chinese: 极好的建议

sentences.english: His car is in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车状况极佳。

sentences.english: Second-hand computers can be excellent value.
sentences.chinese: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

detailed_translations.english: extremely good or of very high quality

name: excellence
trans: n. 优秀；美德；长处

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: excellently
trans: adv. 极好地；优异地

name: excessively
trans: adv. 过分地；极度

sentences.english: excessively high prices
sentences.chinese: 过高的价格

detailed_translations.english: greater than what seems reasonable or appropriate

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: excited
trans: v. 激动；唤起（excite的过去分词）

sentences.english: Steve flies home tomorrow – we’re all really excited.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫明天坐飞机回家——我们都非常激动。

sentences.english: The food was nothing to get excited about (= not very good or special ).
sentences.chinese: 食物很一般，没什么特别。

sentences.english: excited crowds of shoppers
sentences.chinese: 兴奋的购物人群

detailed_translations.english: happy, interested, or hopeful because something good has happened or will happen

name: exciting
trans: adj. 令人兴奋的；使人激动的

sentences.english: an exciting discovery
sentences.chinese: 激动人心的发现

sentences.english: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.chinese: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.english: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。

sentences.english: Let’s do something exciting.
sentences.chinese: 我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.english: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel excited

name: excuse
trans: n. 借口；理由

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: expect
trans: vi. 期待；预期

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: expectation
trans: n. 期待；预期；指望

sentences.english: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: experience
trans: n. 经验；经历；体验

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

name: explain
trans: v. 说明；解释

sentences.english: He carefully explained the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细解释了程序。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone about something in a way that is clear or easy to understand

name: explanation
trans: n. 说明，解释；辩解

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

name: explosive
trans: n. 炸药；爆炸物

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

name: explosion
trans: n. 爆炸；爆发；激增

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

name: explode
trans: vi. 爆炸，爆发；激增

sentences.english: The device was thrown at an army patrol but failed to explode.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.english: Far sooner than anyone thought possible, the Russians exploded an atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

detailed_translations.english: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

name: express
trans: n. 快车，快递，专使；捷运公司

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: extreme
trans: n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: extremely
trans: adv. 非常，极其；极端地

sentences.english: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 地震非常难以预测。

sentences.english: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 给你添了麻烦，我十分抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: factor
trans: n. 因素；要素；[物] 因数；代理人

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: fail
trans: n. 不及格

sentences.english: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
sentences.chinese: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

sentences.english: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (= been completely unsuccessful ).
sentences.chinese: 数百万人戒过烟，都以惨败告终。

sentences.english: his efforts to save his failing marriage
sentences.chinese: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力

sentences.english: The brakes on my bike failed half way down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我骑自行车下山到中途刹车失灵了。

detailed_translations.english: to not succeed in achieving something

name: failure
trans: n. 失败；故障；失败者；破产

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

name: familiar
trans: n. 常客；密友

sentences.english: a familiar tune
sentences.chinese: 熟悉的曲调

sentences.english: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
sentences.chinese: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。

sentences.english: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
sentences.chinese: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: This kind of situation was all too familiar (= very familiar ) to John.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。

sentences.english: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
sentences.chinese: 她看起来有点面熟，但我还是认不出她来。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize

name: familiarity
trans: n. 熟悉，精通；亲密；随便

sentences.english: I miss the familiarity of home.
sentences.chinese: 我怀念家的那种亲切感。

detailed_translations.english: a good knowledge of a particular subject or place

name: family
trans: n. 家庭；亲属；家族；子女；[生]科；语族；[化]族

sentences.english: Do you know the family next door?
sentences.chinese: 你认识隔壁那家人吗？

sentences.english: The Webb family still has its farm over there.
sentences.chinese: 韦伯家依然保留着那里的农场。

sentences.english: The family now live in London.
sentences.chinese: 那家人现居伦敦。

sentences.english: This house isn’t big enough for a family of seven.
sentences.chinese: 这房子住不下七口之家。

sentences.english: My family come from Scotland originally.
sentences.chinese: 我祖籍是苏格兰。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children

name: famous
trans: adj. 著名的；极好的，非常令人满意的

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

name: famously
trans: adv. 著名地；极好地

name: fast
trans: n. 斋戒；绝食

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: fear
trans: n. 害怕；恐惧；敬畏；担心

sentences.english: a fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 害怕坐飞机

sentences.english: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
sentences.chinese: 该团体担心发生暴力事件，所以请求警方保护。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen
to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

name: federal
trans: adv. 联邦政府地

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: federally
trans: adv. 联邦地；联邦政府地；同盟地

name: feel
trans: n. 感觉；触摸

sentences.english: I am feeling very depressed.
sentences.chinese: 我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Suddenly I felt a sharp pain in my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到肩部一阵剧痛。

sentences.english: I felt as if all my strength had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得好象自己的力气已经全没了。

sentences.english: I felt like I was being kicked in the teeth every day.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉我好像每天都在经受挫折。

detailed_translations.english: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it
to give you a particular physical feeling, especially when you touch or hold something

name: feeling
trans: n. 感觉，触觉；感情，情绪；同情

sentences.english: Knowing we’d won was a wonderful feeling.
sentences.chinese: 得知我们赢了，感觉真好。

sentences.english: He’s considerate of other people’s feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他很顾及他人的感情。

detailed_translations.english: an emotion that you feel, such as anger, sadness, or happiness

name: few
trans: n. 很少数

sentences.english: ...spending her few waking hours in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: …把她清醒的个把钟头花在电视机前。

detailed_translations.english: not many or hardly any people or things

name: field
trans: n. 领域；牧场；旷野；战场；运动场

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: fill
trans: n. 满足；填满的量；装填物

sentences.english: He poured her a drink, then filled his own glass.
sentences.chinese: 他给她倒了一杯，然后将自己的杯子斟满。

sentences.english: My job was filling the flour sacks.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作是装面粉袋。

sentences.english: Take a deep breath and allow your lungs to fill.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，让肺部涨满。

sentences.english: There was just enough wind to fill the sails.
sentences.chinese: 正好有足够大的风鼓满船帆。

sentences.english: Miller’s band was filling dance halls (= attracting a lot of people ) all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 米勒的乐队在全国各地的舞厅都人气爆棚。

sentences.english: Numerous pictures fill every available space.
sentences.chinese: 密密麻麻的照片填满了每一块空处。

detailed_translations.english: if a container or place fills, or if you fill it, enough of something goes into it to make it full

name: finally
trans: adv. 最后；终于；决定性地

sentences.english: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 几经耽搁后，我们终于在六点起飞了。

sentences.english: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 最后，卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time

name: final
trans: n. 决赛；期末考试；当日报纸的末版

sentences.english: The final episode will be shown tonight.
sentences.chinese: 最后一集将于今晚播出。

sentences.english: students preparing for their final examinations
sentences.chinese: 正在准备期末考试的学生

sentences.english: Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
sentences.chinese: 斯通正在拍摄越战三部曲的最后一部。

sentences.english: the final stages in their relationship
sentences.chinese: 他们之间关系的最后阶段

sentences.english: They scored in the final minutes of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们在比赛的最后几分钟得分。

sentences.english: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以提出建议，但是最终的决定权还是在客户自己手里。

detailed_translations.english: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

name: financial
trans: adj. 金融的；财政的，财务的

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: finance
trans: n. 财政，财政学；金融

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

detailed_translations.chinese: 财政，金融；财源，财务情况
detailed_translations.english: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

name: find
trans: n. 发现

sentences.english: I can’t find the car keys.
sentences.chinese: 我找不到汽车钥匙。

sentences.english: Hold on while I find a pen.
sentences.chinese: 别挂电话，我找支笔。

sentences.english: Her body was later found hidden in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 后来有人发现她的尸体被藏在了灌木丛里。

sentences.english: I have to find somewhere else to live.
sentences.chinese: 我得另找住处。

sentences.english: She had almost given up hope of finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 她差不多要放弃找个丈夫的希望了。

sentences.english: Her mother went to the shops, and on her return, Kathleen was nowhere to be found (= could not be found ) .
sentences.chinese: 妈妈去买东西，回来的时候凯思琳找不到了。

detailed_translations.english: to discover, see, or get something that you have been searching for

name: finding
trans: n. 发现；裁决；发现物

sentences.english: Surveys conducted in other countries reported similar findings.
sentences.chinese: 在其他国家进行的调查也报告说有类似的结果。

detailed_translations.english: the information that someone has discovered as a result of their study, work etc

name: finish
trans: n. 结束；完美；回味（葡萄酒）

sentences.english: You can’t go anywhere until you’ve finished your homework.
sentences.chinese: 没完成家庭作业前你哪儿也不能去。

sentences.english: Have you finished that book yet?
sentences.chinese: 那本书你看完了吗？

sentences.english: ‘How’s the decorating going?’ ‘We’ve nearly finished.’
sentences.chinese: “装修进行得怎么样了？”“差不多快完成了。”

sentences.english: The football season finishes in May.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛季在 5 月份结束。

sentences.english: a dramatic finish to the race
sentences.chinese: 赛跑的戏剧性结局

detailed_translations.english: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
the end or last part of something

name: for
trans: prep. 为，为了；因为；给；对于；至于；适合于

sentences.english: I’ve got a present for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有件礼物送给你。

sentences.english: Someone left a message for Vicky.
sentences.chinese: 有人给维基留了言。

sentences.english: an English course for foreign students
sentences.chinese: 为外国学生开的一门英语课程

sentences.english: WWhat did you do that for?
sentences.chinese: 你那样做是为了什么？

sentences.english: We could hardly see for the mist.
sentences.chinese: 由于雾气，我们几乎什么也看不见。

detailed_translations.english: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used

name: force
trans: n. 力量；武力；军队；魄力

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: forgive
trans: vt. 原谅；免除（债务、义务等）

sentences.english: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget (= forgive someone and no longer think about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

detailed_translations.english: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

name: forgiveness
trans: n. 宽恕；宽仁之心

sentences.english: ...a spirit of forgiveness and national reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: …一种宽恕与民族和解的精神。

detailed_translations.english: when someone forgives another person

name: form
trans: n. 形式，形状；形态，外形；方式；表格

sentences.english: We oppose racism in all its forms.
sentences.chinese: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

sentences.english: The female form is a thing of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 女性形体是一种美。

sentences.english: The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。

detailed_translations.english: the way something is or appears to be
to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process

name: former
trans: n. 模型，样板；起形成作用的人

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: fortunately
trans: adv. 幸运地

sentences.english: Fortunately, everything worked out all right in the end.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，最后一切顺利。

detailed_translations.english: happening because of good luck

name: fortunate
trans: adj. 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: forward
trans: n. 前锋

sentences.english: He leaned forward , his elbows resting on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他身体前倾，胳膊肘撑在桌子上。

sentences.english: The crowd surged forwards.
sentences.chinese: 人群向前涌去。

sentences.english: The next scene takes the story forward five years.
sentences.chinese: 下一个场面是描述故事中五年后的情况。

detailed_translations.english: towards a place or position that is in front of you

name: frequent
trans: adj. 频繁的；时常发生的；惯常的

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

name: frequency
trans: n. 频率；频繁

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

name: frequently
trans: adv. 频繁地，经常地；时常，屡次

sentences.english: He was frequently drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他经常喝醉。

detailed_translations.english: very often or many times

name: fresh
trans: n. 开始；新生；泛滥

sentences.english: I’ll just make some fresh coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我来重新煮点咖啡。

sentences.english: The report provides fresh evidence about the way the business was run.
sentences.chinese: 报告提供了有关该公司运营方式的新证据。

sentences.english: You’ll have to start again on a fresh sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 你得拿张新的纸重新开始。

sentences.english: The beans are fresh from the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这些豆子是刚从园子里摘来的。

detailed_translations.english: adding to or replacing something

name: freshly
trans: adv. 新近；精神饱满地

sentences.english: ...freshly baked bread.
sentences.chinese: …刚烤出的面包。

detailed_translations.english: If something is freshly made or done, it has been recently made or done

name: frighten
trans: vt. 使惊吓；吓唬…

sentences.english: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.english: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.english: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid

name: frightening
trans: adj. 令人恐惧的；引起突然惊恐的

sentences.english: Going into hospital can be very frightening for a child.
sentences.chinese: 去医院对小孩子来说可能是很可怕的。

sentences.english: It was the most frightening experience of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中最可怕的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel afraid or nervous

name: frightened
trans: v. 害怕；使吃惊；吓走（frighten的过去分词）

sentences.english: Don’t be frightened. We’re not going to hurt you.
sentences.chinese: 别害怕，我们不会伤害你的。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, I was frightened to death (= very frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 说实话，我怕得要命。

sentences.english: a frightened horse
sentences.chinese: 一匹受惊的马

detailed_translations.chinese: 害怕的；受惊的；受恐吓的
detailed_translations.english: feeling afraid

detailed_translations.chinese: 害怕；使吃惊；吓走（frighten的过去分词）

name: fun
trans: n. 乐趣；玩笑；有趣的人或事

sentences.english: There’s plenty of fun for all the family.
sentences.chinese: 可以让全家人玩得很开心。

sentences.english: The children were having so much fun, I hated to call them inside.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子玩得很开心，我不忍心把他们叫进来。

detailed_translations.english: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting

name: fund
trans: n. 基金；资金；存款

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

name: future
trans: n. 未来；前途；期货；将来时

sentences.english: What are your plans for the future?
sentences.chinese: 你未来有什么打算？

sentences.english: The islands should have the right to decide their own future.
sentences.chinese: 这些岛屿应当有权决定自己的未来。

sentences.english: a leader who will shape the organization’s future
sentences.chinese: 将决定该组织未来的一位领导者

detailed_translations.english: the time after the present

name: gentle
trans: n. 蛆，饵

sentences.english: Arthur was a very gentle, caring person.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟是一个非常温柔体贴的人。

sentences.english: After a little gentle persuasion , she agreed to go back to her family.
sentences.chinese: 经过几句温和的劝说，她同意回到家里去。

detailed_translations.english: kind and careful in the way you behave or do things, so that you do not hurt or damage anyone or anything

name: get
trans: n. 生殖；幼兽

sentences.english: We need to get help quickly!
sentences.chinese: 我们需要马上得到帮助！

sentences.english: It would be a good idea to get professional advice.
sentences.chinese: 征求专业人士的意见，这个主意很好。

sentences.english: You may be able to get a grant from the local authority.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以从当地政府获得拨款。

sentences.english: He cleared his throat to get our attention.
sentences.chinese: 他清清嗓子来引起我们的注意。

sentences.english: What time will we get there?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候可以到那里？

sentences.english: We got to Paris that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我们到了巴黎。

sentences.english: She soon got bored with the job.
sentences.chinese: 她不久就厌倦了这份工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 获得，得到；到达；变成，成为
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by finding it, asking for it, or paying for it

name: give
trans: n. 弹性；弯曲；伸展性

sentences.english: Researchers were given a £10,000 grant to continue their work.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员得到一万英镑的经费以继续他们的研究。

sentences.english: I’ve got some old diaries that my grandmother gave me years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我有几本旧日记本，是多年前祖母给我的。

sentences.english: I didn’t steal it! Maria gave it to me!
sentences.chinese: 我不是偷的！是玛丽亚给我的！

sentences.english: Most people are willing to give to charity .
sentences.chinese: 大多数人都愿意向慈善事业捐款。

sentences.english: The situation is now desperate, so please give generously .
sentences.chinese: 现在情况危急，请大家慷慨解囊。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have something as a present, or to provide something for someone

name: glance
trans: n. 一瞥；一滑；闪光

sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

name: go
trans: n. 去；进行；尝试

sentences.english: The plate went crashing to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声掉在地板上。

sentences.english: The bullet went flying over my head.
sentences.chinese: 子弹从我头顶飞过。

sentences.english: John went rushing off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 约翰沿走廊飞奔而去。

sentences.english: Her hair is starting to go grey.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发开始变白了。

detailed_translations.english: to move in a particular way, or to do something as you are moving

name: good
trans: n. 好处；善行；慷慨的行为

sentences.english: a good hotel
sentences.chinese: 一家不错的宾馆

sentences.english: good quality cloth
sentences.chinese: 优质布料

sentences.english: The train service is not very good.
sentences.chinese: 火车服务不是很好。

sentences.english: My French is better than my Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 我的法语比西班牙语好。

sentences.english: Alex is very good at languages.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯在语言方面很擅长。

sentences.english: She’s a very good player.
sentences.chinese: 她是一名非常优秀的球员。

detailed_translations.english: of a high standard or quality

name: grant
trans: n. 拨款；[法] 授予物

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: gratitude
trans: n. 感谢（的心情）；感激

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: great
trans: n. 大师；大人物；伟人们

sentences.english: The movie was a great success.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片大获成功。

sentences.english: The news came as possibly the greatest shock of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息可能是我一生中最大的打击。

sentences.english: The paintings cost a great deal (= a lot ) of money.
sentences.chinese: 这些画价值不菲。

sentences.english: John always takes great care over his work.
sentences.chinese: 约翰工作时总是非常小心。

sentences.english: It’s a great pity that none of his poems survive.
sentences.chinese: 非常遗憾，他的诗歌没有一首保存下来。

sentences.english: The temptation was too great to resist.
sentences.chinese: 诱惑太大，难以抵挡。

sentences.english: one of the greatest scientific achievements of our time
sentences.chinese: 我们这个时代最伟大的科学成就之一

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or degree

name: greatly
trans: adv. 很，大大地；非常

sentences.english: All offers of help will be greatly appreciated .
sentences.chinese: 如蒙帮助，感激不尽。

sentences.english: The quality of health care varies greatly .
sentences.chinese: 医疗保健服务质量差别很大。

detailed_translations.english: extremely or very much

name: grow
trans: vi. 发展；生长；渐渐变得…

sentences.english: Support for Mr Thompson is growing.
sentences.chinese: 汤普森先生的支持率在上升。

sentences.english: a tree which will grow well in most types of soil
sentences.chinese: 在大部分土壤里都能生长得很好的一种树

name: grower
trans: n. 栽培者；生长物

sentences.english: The state's apple growers are fighting an uphill battle against foreign competition.
sentences.chinese: 该州的苹果种植者们正在与外来竞争进行艰难的抗争。

detailed_translations.english: A grower is a person who grows large quantities of a particular plant or crop in order to sell them

name: growth
trans: n. 增长；发展；生长；种植

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

name: happen
trans: vi. 发生；碰巧；偶然遇到

sentences.english: When did the accident happen?
sentences.chinese: 事故什么时候发生的？

sentences.english: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.chinese: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.english: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.chinese: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.english: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 这事注定早晚会发生。

sentences.english: This kind of thing happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这种事一直在发生。

sentences.english: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
sentences.chinese: 真巧，我正好认识一个人，这个人也许帮得上忙。

sentences.english: We happened to discover we had a friend in common.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰巧发现我们有个共同的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

name: happy
trans: adj. 幸福的；高兴的；巧妙的

sentences.english: It’s a lovely house and we’ve been very happy here.
sentences.chinese: 房子很漂亮，我们住在这里非常开心。

sentences.english: I’ve never felt happier in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生从未感到如此快乐。

sentences.english: He was a happy child who rarely cried.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个快乐的孩子，很少哭鼻子。

sentences.english: the happy faces of the children
sentences.chinese: 孩子们快乐的表情

sentences.english: This has been the happiest day of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中最快乐的一天。

detailed_translations.english: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life

name: unhappy
trans: adj. 不快乐的；不幸福的；不适当的

sentences.english: If you’re so unhappy, why don’t you change jobs?
sentences.chinese: 你要是那么不开心，为什么不换个工作呢？

sentences.english: Leslie had an unhappy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯利的童年很不幸。

sentences.english: an unhappy marriage
sentences.chinese: 不幸的婚姻

sentences.english: I was desperately unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 我非常不快乐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不快乐的；不幸福的；不适当的
detailed_translations.english: not happy

name: happiness
trans: n. 幸福

sentences.english: Juliet’s eyes shone with happiness.
sentences.chinese: 朱丽叶的双眼闪耀着幸福的光芒。

sentences.english: We want our children to have the best possible chance of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望自己的孩子得到追求幸福的最佳机会。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being happy

name: harm
trans: n. 伤害；损害

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: harmful
trans: adj. 有害的；能造成损害的

sentences.english: the harmful effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: causing harm

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获；产量；结果

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: have
trans: aux. 已经

sentences.english: Our guests have arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我们的客人到了。

sentences.english: Has anyone phoned?
sentences.chinese: 有人打过电话来吗？

sentences.english: We’ve been spending too much money.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经花掉太多钱了。

sentences.english: I hadn’t seen him for 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 我已经15年没见他了。

sentences.english: ‘I hope you’ve read the instructions.’ ‘Yes, of course I have.’
sentences.chinese: “我希望你已经看过使用说明了。”“当然看过了。”

sentences.english: You haven’t done much, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你没做多少，是吗？

sentences.english: They used to have a Mercedes Benz.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾经拥有一辆奔驰汽车。

sentences.english: She sat down and had another drink.
sentences.chinese: 她坐下来又喝了一杯。

detailed_translations.chinese: （与过去分词连用构成完成时）
detailed_translations.english: used with past participles to form perfect tenses
used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use

name: healthy
trans: adj. 健康的，健全的；有益于健康的

sentences.english: a healthy baby boy
sentences.chinese: 健康的男婴

sentences.english: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在，我的身体一直非常健康。

sentences.english: a healthy lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 健康的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak

name: healthily
trans: adv. 健康地

name: health
trans: n. 健康；卫生；保健；兴旺

sentences.english: I’m worried about my husband’s health.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我丈夫的健康状况。

sentences.english: Even if you haven’t got much money, at least you’ve got your health.
sentences.chinese: 即使你没有太多钱，但起码你拥有健康。

detailed_translations.english: the general condition of your body and how healthy you are

name: help
trans: n. 帮助；补救办法；帮忙者；有益的东西

sentences.english: If there’s anything I can do to help, just give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要我帮忙，就给我打个电话。

sentences.english: Thank you for all your help.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你的一切帮助。

detailed_translations.english: to make it possible or easier for someone to do something by doing part of their work or by giving them something they need
things you do to make it easier or possible for someone to do something

name: helpful
trans: adj. 有帮助的；有益的

sentences.english: Thank you for your advice; it’s been very helpful.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的建议，它非常有用。

sentences.english: It is helpful if we address a few key questions here.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们在这里解决一些关键问题会很有用的。

detailed_translations.english: providing useful help in making a situation better or easier

name: hide
trans: n. 躲藏；兽皮；躲藏处

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: hidden
trans: adj. 隐藏的

sentences.english: the use of hidden cameras
sentences.chinese: 隐藏式摄像机的使用

sentences.english: Some areas can hold hidden dangers for dogs.
sentences.chinese: 一些区域可能对狗有隐伏的危险。

sentences.english: the hidden meaning behind his words
sentences.chinese: 他的言外之意

sentences.chinese: 小心酒店账单中有隐性收费。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to see or find

name: hear
trans: vi. 听；听见

sentences.english: Blanche heard a crash as the back door was flung open.
sentences.chinese: 布兰奇听见后门哗啦一声被推开。

sentences.english: Did anyone see or hear anything last night?
sentences.chinese: 昨晚有没有人看见或听见什么？

sentences.english: Old Zeke doesn’t hear too well any more.
sentences.chinese: 老齐克的耳朵已不灵了。

sentences.english: I heard a rumor that he was getting married soon.
sentences.chinese: 我听到传闻，说他马上要结婚了。

sentences.english: The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 最高法院于周二审理了此案。

detailed_translations.english: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears

name: high
trans: n. 高水平；天空；由麻醉品引起的快感；高压地带

sentences.english: This is the highest mountain in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这是日本最高的山。

sentences.english: The camp was surrounded by a high fence.
sentences.chinese: 营地四周围着高高的栅栏。

sentences.english: a ten-foot high statue
sentences.chinese: 10英尺高的雕像

sentences.english: How high is the Eiffel Tower?
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔有多高？

sentences.english: He kicked the ball high into the air, over the heads of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他把球高高地踢向空中，越过了人群。

detailed_translations.english: measuring a long distance from the bottom to the top
at or to a level high above the ground, the floor etc

name: highly
trans: adv. 高度地；非常；非常赞许地

sentences.english: Tom’s mother was highly critical of the school’s approach.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

sentences.english: highly competitive industries
sentences.chinese: 竞争非常激烈的行业

sentences.english: a highly desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 宜居的街区

sentences.english: T.S. Eliot’s highly influential poem, ‘The Waste Land’ T.S.
sentences.chinese: 艾略特极有影响力的诗作《荒原》

sentences.english: a highly developed economy
sentences.chinese: 高度发达的经济

detailed_translations.english: very

name: home
trans: n. 家，住宅；产地；家乡；避难所

sentences.english: They have a beautiful home in California.
sentences.chinese: 他们在加州有个美丽的家。

sentences.english: Good luck in your new home!
sentences.chinese: 祝你在新家一切顺利！

sentences.english: A family of birds made their home (= started living ) under the roof.
sentences.chinese: 一窝鸟在屋顶下安了家。

sentences.english: These children need a proper home life.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要正常的家庭生活。

detailed_translations.english: the house, apartment, or place where you live
relating to or belonging to your home or family

name: homeless
trans: adj. 无家可归的

sentences.english: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
sentences.chinese: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

detailed_translations.english: without a home

name: honesty
trans: n. 诚实，正直

sentences.english: a politician of rare honesty and courage
sentences.chinese: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest

name: honest
trans: adj. 诚实的，实在的；可靠的；坦率的

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

name: however
trans: conj. 无论以何种方式; 不管怎样

sentences.english: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
sentences.chinese: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法，不过有危险。

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
sentences.chinese: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

sentences.english: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么看，它都要花很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said

name: idea
trans: n. 想法；主意；概念

sentences.english: You should talk to Ken – he's always full of good ideas.
sentences.chinese: 你应该和肯谈谈，他总是满脑子好主意。

sentences.english: I knew it was a bad idea to leave him on his own.
sentences.chinese: 我知道把他独自留下不是个好主意。

sentences.english: It was my wife’s idea to move house.
sentences.chinese: 要搬家是我妻子的主意。

sentences.english: He has some very strange ideas about education.
sentences.chinese: 他对教育有些非常奇怪的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion for a possible course of action, especially one that you think of suddenly

name: ideally
trans: adv. 理想地；观念上地

sentences.english: Ideally, your car should have high-security locks.
sentences.chinese: 最理想的情况是，你的车应该配有高度安全的车锁。

sentences.english: Fruit and vegetables should ideally be organically grown.
sentences.chinese: 水果和蔬菜最理想的应该是有机种植。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe the way you would like things to be, even though this may not be possible

name: ignore
trans: vt. 驳回诉讼；忽视；不理睬

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: imagine
trans: vi. 想像；猜想；想像起来

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

name: imitation
trans: n. 模仿，仿造；仿制品

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: impact
trans: vi. 影响；撞击；冲突；压紧（on，upon，with）

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: important
trans: adj. 重要的，重大的；有地位的；有权力的

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

name: unimportant
trans: adj. 不重要的；琐碎的

sentences.english: unimportant details
sentences.chinese: 无关紧要的细枝末节

detailed_translations.english: not important

name: importantly
trans: adv. 重要地；大量地；有名望地；自命不凡地

name: importance
trans: n. 价值；重要；重大；傲慢

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

name: impossible
trans: n. 不可能；不可能的事

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。

sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

name: impossibility
trans: n. 不可能；不可能的事

sentences.english: Obviously, given that impossibility, we have to do the next best thing.
sentences.chinese: 明显地，考虑到那是不可能的，我们必须做好下一个事情。

sentences.english: After all, there does not seem to be any inherent impossibility in the combination.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，在这种组合中似乎没有任何固有的不可能性。

sentences.english: I, frankly, find this concept a near impossibility for the company to accomplish at present.
sentences.chinese: 说实话，我觉得这个理念是现在微软几乎不可能实现的了的。

name: impossibly
trans: adv. 不可能地；难以置信地；无法可想地

name: include
trans: vt. 包含，包括

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: incorrect
trans: adj. 错误的，不正确的；不适当的；不真实的

sentences.english: The information you gave us was incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 你给我们的信息不准确。

detailed_translations.english: not correct or true

name: incorrectly
trans: adv. 错误地；不适当地

name: increase
trans: n. 增加，增长；提高

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: individual
trans: n. 个人，个体

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: individually
trans: adv. 个别地，单独地

sentences.english: The bridegroom thanked them all individually.
sentences.chinese: 新郎向他们一一道谢。

sentences.english: individually wrapped portions of cheese
sentences.chinese: 独立包装的一份份干酪

detailed_translations.english: separately, not together in a group

name: industry
trans: n. 产业；工业；勤勉

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: industrial
trans: n. 工业股票；工业工人

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: influence
trans: n. 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料；知识；情报；通知

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: insist
trans: vi. 坚持，强调

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: inspiring
trans: v. 鼓舞；激发；使感悟（inspire的ing形式）

sentences.english: inspiring music
sentences.chinese: 激励人心的音乐

sentences.english: King was a great orator and an inspiring leader.
sentences.chinese: 金是伟大的演说家和鼓舞人心的领袖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞人心的；灌输的；启发灵感的
detailed_translations.english: giving people a feeling of excitement and a desire to do something great

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞；激发；使感悟（inspire的ing形式）

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: instead
trans: adv. 代替；反而；相反

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；情报工作；情报机关；理解力；才智，智慧；天分

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；趣味；同行

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。
