sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: interested
trans: v. 使…感兴趣（interest的过去分词）

sentences.english: I wasn’t sure if he was really interested or if he was just being polite.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢肯定他是真的感兴趣，还是出于礼貌而已。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感兴趣的；有权益的；有成见的
detailed_translations.english: giving a lot of attention to something because you want to find out more about it or because you enjoy it

name: interesting
trans: adj. 有趣的；引起兴趣的，令人关注的

sentences.english: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.english: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.chinese: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.english: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.chinese: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.english: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.chinese: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

detailed_translations.english: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

name: intimate
trans: n. 知己；至交

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: involve
trans: vt. 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: isolate
trans: n. [生物] 隔离种群

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: isolation
trans: n. 隔离；孤立；[电] 绝缘；[化学] 离析

sentences.english: Because of its geographical isolation, the area developed its own unique culture.
sentences.chinese: 由于地理上的隔绝，该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

sentences.english: The mansion sits in splendid isolation on top of the hill (= it is far from everything and looks impressive ).
sentences.chinese: 宅邸位于山顶，远离尘嚣。

sentences.english: a patient’s isolation period
sentences.chinese: 病人的隔离期

detailed_translations.english: when one group, person, or thing is separate from others

name: isolated
trans: adj. 孤立的；分离的；单独的；[电] 绝缘的

sentences.english: small isolated communities
sentences.chinese: 偏僻的小社区

sentences.english: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 隔离的， 分离的； 与世隔绝的， 偏僻的； 孤立的， 孤独的； 个别的
detailed_translations.english: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others

name: item
trans: n. 条款，项目；一则；一件商品（或物品）

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

name: itself
trans: pron. 它自己；它本身

sentences.english: The cat lay on the sofa, washing itself.
sentences.chinese: 猫躺在沙发上把自己舔干。

sentences.english: The machine switches itself off when the process is complete.
sentences.chinese: 工作程序结束，机器会自动关闭。

sentences.english: a small local enterprise that has transformed itself into a highly successful company
sentences.chinese: 已发展为业绩喜人的公司的一家小型地方企业

detailed_translations.english: used to show that a thing, organization, animal, or baby that does something is affected by its own action

name: joy
trans: n. 欢乐，快乐；乐趣；高兴

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

name: judge
trans: vt. 判断；审判

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: just
trans: adv. 只是，仅仅；刚才，刚刚；正好，恰好；实在；刚要

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

name: keep
trans: vt. 保持；经营；遵守；饲养

sentences.english: The noise kept him awake.
sentences.chinese: 噪音使他一直醒着。

sentences.english: I was struggling to keep awake.
sentences.chinese: 我努力不让自己睡着。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in a particular state, condition, or position, or to make someone or something do this

name: kind
trans: n. 种类；性质

sentences.english: Get me a sandwich – any kind will do.
sentences.chinese: 给我一份三明治，随便哪种都可以。

detailed_translations.english: one of the different types of a person or thing that belong to the same group

name: know
trans: vt. 知道；认识；懂得

sentences.english: Who knows the answer?
sentences.chinese: 谁知道答案？

sentences.english: There are instructions telling you everything you need to know.
sentences.chinese: 操作指南会告诉你所有须知事项。

sentences.english: Didn’t you know that?
sentences.chinese: 你不知道那件事吗？

sentences.english: I know all about David and what he’s been up to!
sentences.chinese: 我对戴维和他一直在干什么都知道得一清二楚！

sentences.english: Let me know (= tell me ) what time you’re planning to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我你打算什么时候到。

sentences.english: I thought you’d want to know immediately.
sentences.chinese: 我以为你想马上知道。

sentences.english: If you must know, I was with James last night (= used when you are angry because someone wants to know something ).
sentences.chinese: 如果你非要知道的话，我昨晚是和詹姆斯在一起。

sentences.english: How did he know (= how did he find information about ) our names?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么知道我们姓名的？

detailed_translations.english: to have information about something

name: label
trans: vt. 标注；贴标签于

sentences.english: a luggage label
sentences.chinese: 行李标签

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
to attach a label onto something or write information on something

name: large
trans: adj. 大的；多数的；广博的

sentences.english: Los Angeles is the second largest city in the US.
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶是美国的第二大城市。

sentences.english: The T-shirt comes in Small, Medium and Large.
sentences.chinese: 这种T恤有小号、中号和大号。

sentences.english: a large ovenproof pan
sentences.chinese: 一只耐热的大烤盘

sentences.english: large sums ofmoney
sentences.chinese: 大笔的钱

sentences.english: those who drink large amounts of coffee
sentences.chinese: 咖啡喝得很多的人

sentences.english: A large number of students have signed up for the course.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生报名读这门课程。

detailed_translations.english: big in size, amount, or number

name: largely
trans: adv. 主要地；大部分；大量地

sentences.english: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
sentences.chinese: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。

sentences.english: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
sentences.chinese: 那一天真累人，主要是因为等得无聊。

detailed_translations.english: mostly or mainly

name: last
trans: n. 末尾，最后；上个；鞋楦（做鞋的模型）

sentences.english: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
sentences.chinese: 我没有看这本书的最后一章。

sentences.english: Add the flour last.
sentences.chinese: 最后加面粉。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
after everything or everyone else

name: late
trans: adj. 晚的；迟的；已故的；最近的

sentences.english: Sorry I’m late – I overslept.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，来晚了——我睡过头了。

sentences.english: The train was even later than usual.
sentences.chinese: 火车到得甚至比平时还晚。

sentences.english: We apologize for the late departure of flight AZ709.
sentences.chinese: 我们为AZ709航班延误起飞表示歉意。

sentences.english: There are penalties if loan repayments are late.
sentences.chinese: 逾期偿还贷款会被处以罚金。

sentences.english: The stores are open later on Thursdays.
sentences.chinese: 商店星期四开门较晚。

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or done after the time that was expected, agreed, or arranged
after the usual time

name: lead
trans: n. 领导；铅；导线；榜样

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: learn
trans: vt. 学习；得知；认识到

sentences.english: What’s the best way to learn a language?
sentences.chinese: 学习语言的最佳方法是什么？

sentences.english: The teacher’s task is to help the pupil learn.
sentences.chinese: 老师的任务是帮助学生学习。

sentences.english: The student will learn from experience about the importance of planning.
sentences.chinese: 学生将从经验中学到制订计划的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, by experience, by studying it, or by being taught

name: lie
trans: vi. 躺；说谎；位于；展现

sentences.english: to lie on your back/side/front
sentences.chinese: 仰 / 侧 / 俯卧

sentences.english: The book lay open on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 那本书摊开放在他的书桌上。

sentences.english: The town lies in a small wooded valley.
sentences.chinese: 该城镇坐落于一个林木茂盛的山谷中。

detailed_translations.english: to be or put yourself in a flat or horizontal position so that you are not standing or sitting

name: life
trans: n. 生活，生存；寿命

sentences.english: Learning goes on throughout life.
sentences.chinese: 学习是一生的事。

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you.
sentences.chinese: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

sentences.english: I’ve known John all my life (= since I was born ).
sentences.chinese: 我从小就认识约翰了。

sentences.english: His main aim in life was to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。

sentences.english: It was one of the best days of my life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最快乐的时光之一。

sentences.english: The accident scarred him for life (= for the rest of his life ).
sentences.chinese: 这场事故给他留下了终生的创伤。

sentences.english: She knew she’d feel guilty for the rest of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己将内疚终生。

sentences.english: Raj spent his life caring for others.
sentences.chinese: 拉杰一辈子都在关爱他人。

sentences.english: Bonington spent his entire adult life in France.
sentences.chinese: 博宁顿成年后就一直在法国生活。

sentences.english: We don’t know much about the poet’s early life (= when he was young ).
sentences.chinese: 我们对这位诗人的早年生活所知甚少。

sentences.english: Poor diet can lead to a whole range of diseases in later life (= when you are older ).
sentences.chinese: 饮食不良会在晚年引发各种疾病。

sentences.english: She married late in life (= when she was fairly old ).
sentences.chinese: 她结婚晚。

sentences.english: He’s a life member (= continuing until he dies ) of the club.
sentences.chinese: 他是俱乐部的终身会员。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time when someone is alive

name: lifelong
trans: adj. 终身的

sentences.english: She became a lifelong friend of ours.
sentences.chinese: 她成了我们一辈子的朋友。

sentences.english: David finally realized his lifelong ambition.
sentences.chinese: 戴维终于实现了他毕生的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing all through your life

name: lifetime
trans: n. 一生；寿命；终生；使用期

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

name: lift
trans: vt. 举起；提升；鼓舞；空运；抄袭

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: like
trans: vt. 喜欢；想；愿意

sentences.english: I like your jacket.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你这件上衣。

sentences.english: I don’t really like classical music.
sentences.chinese: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。

sentences.english: Do you like this colour?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？

sentences.english: I like my coffee quite weak.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。

sentences.english: I don’t like it when you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。

sentences.english: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?
sentences.chinese: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？

sentences.english: I quite like their new album.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。

sentences.english: We really liked the film.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。

sentences.english: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

sentences.english: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想当单亲家长。

sentences.english: Would you like a drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝一杯吗？

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

name: likely
trans: adj. 很可能的；合适的；有希望的

sentences.english: Snow showers are likely tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能有阵雪。

sentences.english: the most likely cause of the problem
sentences.chinese: 造成这个问题最有可能的原因

sentences.english: It is more than likely (= almost certain ) the votes will have to be counted again.
sentences.chinese: 选票很有可能要重新点算。

sentences.english: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely (= not very likely ).
sentences.chinese: 这有可能是意外事故，但可能性不大。

sentences.english: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
sentences.chinese: 我要是处在你这种情况，也很有可能会那样做的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
probably

name: list
trans: n. [计] 列表；清单；目录

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: listen
trans: vi. 听，倾听；听从，听信

sentences.english: Listen! There’s a strange noise in the engine.
sentences.chinese: 听！引擎发出奇怪的声音。

sentences.english: I told him not to go, but he just wouldn’t listen.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他不要去，可他就是不听。

detailed_translations.english: to pay attention to what someone is saying or to a sound that you can hear

name: little
trans: adj. 小的；很少的；短暂的；小巧可爱的

sentences.english: a little house
sentences.chinese: 小屋

sentences.english: a cake decorated with little flowers
sentences.chinese: 点缀着小花的蛋糕

sentences.english: She was cutting the meat up into little bits.
sentences.chinese: 她把肉切成小丁。

sentences.english: Let me tell you a little bit about myself.
sentences.chinese: 我来给你稍微讲讲我自己吧。

sentences.english: We didn’t have toys like this when I was little.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，我们没有这样的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: small in size

name: live
trans: adj. 活的；生动的；实况转播的；精力充沛的

sentences.english: He lives just across the street from me.
sentences.chinese: 他就住在我街对面。

sentences.english: We live only a few miles from the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。

sentences.english: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
sentences.chinese: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。

sentences.english: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到那地方，就觉得不想住在那儿。

sentences.english: Does Paul stilllive here?
sentences.chinese: 保罗还住在这儿吗？

sentences.english: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们还在找住的地方。

sentences.english: They’ve finally found a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

sentences.english: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home(= live with their parents ).
sentences.chinese: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。

sentences.english: I’m quite happy living alone.
sentences.chinese: 我一个人住很开心。

sentences.english: The house has 3,600 square feet of living space(= the areas of a house you live in ).
sentences.chinese: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

detailed_translations.english: if you live in a place, you have your home there
not dead or artificial

name: living
trans: adj. 活的；现存的；活跃的；逼真的

sentences.english: He’s one of the greatest living composers.
sentences.chinese: 他是仍然健在的最伟大的作曲家之一。

sentences.english: The sun affects all living things (= people, animals, and plants ).
sentences.chinese: 太阳与一切生物息息相关。

sentences.english: a living language
sentences.chinese: 活语言，仍在使用的语言

sentences.english: It’s not a great job, but it’s a living.
sentences.chinese: 这不是什么了不起的工作，不过是一种生计。

detailed_translations.english: alive now
the way that you earn money or the money that you earn

name: local
trans: n. [计] 局部；当地居民；本地新闻

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: locally
trans: adv. 局部地；在本地

sentences.english: I live locally, so it’s easy to get to the office.
sentences.chinese: 我就住在附近，所以上班很方便。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在本地, 地方性地, 局部地
detailed_translations.english: in or near the area where you are, or the area you are talking about

name: long
trans: n. 长时间；[语] 长音节；（服装的）长尺寸；长裤

sentences.english: He longed to see her again.
sentences.chinese: 到那里去要多长时间？

sentences.english: She longed for the chance to speak to him in private.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望有机会和他私下交谈。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much, especially when it seems unlikely to happen soon

name: length
trans: n. 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

name: look
trans: vt. 看；期待；注意；面向；看上去像

sentences.english: We sneaked out while Jessie’s mom wasn’t looking.
sentences.chinese: 我们趁杰茜的妈妈没有看到，偷偷地溜了出去。

sentences.english: If you look carefully you can see that the painting represents a human figure.
sentences.chinese: 如果仔细看，就会看出画上是一个人形。

sentences.english: Gina covered her eyes, afraid to look.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜捂住眼睛，不敢看。

sentences.english: Let me have a look at that – I think it’s mine.
sentences.chinese: 让我看一下那个东西——我想它是我的。

detailed_translations.english: to turn your eyes towards something, so that you can see it
an act of looking at something

name: lose
trans: vt. 浪费；使沉溺于；使迷路；遗失；错过

sentences.english: I’ve lost my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 我已经没有了胃口。

sentences.english: Try not to lose heart (= become sad and hopeless ) - there are plenty of other jobs.
sentences.chinese: 不要灰心―还有很多其他的工作。

sentences.english: By the time the ambulance arrived, Douglas had lost consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 救护车赶到时，道格拉斯已经失去知觉。

sentences.english: I followed her on foot, but lost her in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我走在她后面，可是在人群中跟丢了。

sentences.english: Klinger lost his seat in the election.
sentences.chinese: 克林格在选举中失去了他的席位。

detailed_translations.english: to stop having a particular attitude, quality, ability etc, or to gradually have less of it

name: loser
trans: n. 失败者；遗失者

name: loss
trans: n. 减少；亏损；失败；遗失

sentences.english: The company is closing down two of its factories, leading to 430 job losses .
sentences.chinese: 公司要关闭其中的两家工厂，这将造成430人失业。

sentences.english: Weight loss should be gradual.
sentences.chinese: 减肥应该循序渐进。

sentences.english: a type of hearing loss that affects language development
sentences.chinese: 一种会影响语言能力发展的听力丧失

sentences.english: Brazil's 2–1 loss to Argentina
sentences.chinese: 巴西对阿根廷1:2的落败

detailed_translations.english: the fact of no longer having something, or of having less of it than you used to have, or the process by which this happens

name: loser
trans: n. 失败者；遗失者

name: love
trans: n. 恋爱；亲爱的；酷爱；喜爱的事物；爱情，爱意；疼爱；热爱；爱人，所爱之物

sentences.english: I love you, Tracy.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，特雷西。

sentences.english: He was the only man she had ever loved.
sentences.chinese: 他是她唯一爱过的男人。

sentences.english: What these kids need is love and support.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要的是关心和支持。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong feeling of  affection  for someone, combined with sexual attraction
a strong feeling of caring about someone, especially a member of your family or a close friend

name: loving
trans: adj. 亲爱的；钟情的；忠诚的

sentences.english: What that child needs is plenty of loving care .
sentences.chinese: 那孩子所需要的是大量的关爱。

sentences.english: He’s very loving and affectionate with his sister.
sentences.chinese: 他很爱他的妹妹，和她很亲暱。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that shows you love someone

name: low
trans: adj. 低的，浅的；卑贱的；粗俗的；消沉的

sentences.english: a low wall/building/table
sentences.chinese: 矮墙 / 建筑物 / 桌子

sentences.english: low clouds
sentences.chinese: 低云

sentences.english: jobs with low status
sentences.chinese: 社会地位低下的职业

detailed_translations.english: not high or tall

name: loyalty
trans: n. 忠诚；忠心；忠实；忠于…感情

sentences.english: Elizabeth understood her husband’s loyalty to his sister.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country etc

name: loyal
trans: adj. 忠诚的，忠心的；忠贞的

sentences.english: a loyal supporter of the team
sentences.chinese: 球队的忠实支持者

sentences.english: her many years of loyal service to the company
sentences.chinese: 她在公司多年的忠诚服务

sentences.english: loyal customers
sentences.chinese: 忠实客户

detailed_translations.english: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

name: make
trans: vt. 使得；进行；布置，准备，整理；制造；认为；获得；形成；安排；引起；构成

sentences.english: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
sentences.chinese: 我来教你怎么做一个箱子存放工具。

sentences.english: A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 一窝老鼠在屋顶上安了家。

sentences.english: She made her own wedding dress.
sentences.chinese: 她的婚纱是自己做的。

sentences.english: The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司制作优质家具有两百多年的历史了。

sentences.english: They met while they were making a film.
sentences.chinese: 他们是在拍电影时认识的。

sentences.english: I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫等了四个小时才有一个医生给我做检查。

detailed_translations.english: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together

name: manufacture
trans: n. 制造；产品；制造业

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: may
trans: aux. 可以，能够；可能，也许；祝，愿；会，能

sentences.english: I may be late, so don’t wait for me.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会迟到，所以别等我。

sentences.english: Some chemicals may cause environmental damage.
sentences.chinese: 有些化学物品可能会给环境造成破坏。

sentences.english: There may not be enough money to pay for the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 可能钱不够支付修理费。

sentences.english: Well, I may have been wrong.
sentences.chinese: 好了，可能是我错了。

sentences.english: They may have called while you were out.
sentences.chinese: 你出去时他们可能给你打过电话。

sentences.english: It may be that Minoan ships were built and repaired here.
sentences.chinese: 米诺斯人的船可能就是在这里建造和修理的。

sentences.english: Your job may well involve some travelling (= it is fairly likely ) .
sentences.chinese: 你的工作很可能有时需要出差。

sentences.english: The problem may be solved in a number of different ways.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题可以用几种不同的方式解决。

sentences.english: We pray for those who died – may they rest in peace.
sentences.chinese: 我们为逝者祈祷——愿他们安息。

detailed_translations.english: if something may happen or may be true, there is a possibility that it will happen or be true but this is not certain

name: meal
trans: n. 一餐，一顿饭；膳食

sentences.english: We must have a meal together some time.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定要找个时间一起吃顿饭。

sentences.english: Dinner is the main meal of the day for most people.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭是大多数人一天中的主餐。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you eat food, for example breakfast or dinner, or the food that you eat on that occasion

name: mean
trans: adj. 平均的；卑鄙的；低劣的；吝啬的

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

name: meaning
trans: n. 意义；含义；意图

sentences.english: What’s the meaning of this? I asked you to be here an hour ago!
sentences.chinese: 这是什么意思？我让你一小时之前就要到的！

detailed_translations.english: the thing or idea that a word, expression, or sign represents

name: meaningful
trans: adj. 有意义的；意味深长的

sentences.english: Sam and Barbara exchanged meaningful glances.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆和芭芭拉交换了会意的眼神。

detailed_translations.english: a look that clearly expresses the way someone feels, even though nothing is said

name: meet
trans: vt. 满足；遇见；对付

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

name: meeting
trans: n. 会议；会见；集会；汇合点

sentences.english: We’re having a meeting next week to discuss the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我们下周将开会讨论此事。

sentences.english: I had felt drawn to Alice ever since our first meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次见到艾丽斯就感觉被她吸引住了

detailed_translations.english: an event at which people meet to discuss and decide things

name: memory
trans: n. 记忆，记忆力；内存，[计] 存储器；回忆

sentences.english: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。

sentences.english: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里

detailed_translations.english: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

name: memorize
trans: vt. 记住，背熟；记忆

sentences.english: He studied his map, trying to memorize the way to Rose's street.
sentences.chinese: 他研究了地图，努力记住去罗丝家那条街的路。

detailed_translations.english: to learn words, music etc so that you know them perfectly

name: mental
trans: adj. 精神的；脑力的；疯的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: mentally
trans: adv. 精神上，智力上；心理上

sentences.english: Above all be mentally prepared for the rigors of each trading day from the time you get up each morning until you go to bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是在精神上对每个交易日的严峻场面作好准备，从每天早晨你爬起来，一直到晚上回到床上。

name: mind
trans: n. 理智，精神；意见；智力；记忆力

sentences.english: It is impossible to understand the complex nature of the human mind.
sentences.chinese: 要想了解人类思维复杂的特性是不可能的。

sentences.english: Mind and body are closely related.
sentences.chinese: 思想和肉体紧密相连。

sentences.english: Meditation involves focusing the mind on a single object or word.
sentences.chinese: 冥想需要把思想集中在一个物体或单词上。

sentences.english: Sorry─your name has gone right out of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 对不起——我完全想不起你的名字了。

detailed_translations.english: your thoughts or your ability to think, feel, and imagine things

name: miracle
trans: n. 奇迹，奇迹般的人或物；惊人的事例

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: misinterpret
trans: vt. 曲解，误解

sentences.english: Some parts of the report could be misinterpreted.
sentences.chinese: 报告的某些部分可能会被误解。

detailed_translations.english: to not understand the correct meaning of something that someone says or does, or of facts that you are considering

name: interpret
trans: vi. 解释；翻译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: mistake
trans: n. 错误；误会；过失

sentences.english: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

sentences.english: She mistook my meaning entirely.
sentences.chinese: 她完全误解了我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect
to understand something wrongly

name: mobile
trans: adj. 可移动的；机动的；易变的；非固定的

sentences.english: mobile air-conditioners
sentences.chinese: 移动式空调器

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)
sentences.chinese: 流动商店 / 图书馆

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

name: modify
trans: vt. 修改，修饰；更改

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: month
trans: n. 月，一个月的时间

sentences.english: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。

sentences.english: She earns about £350 a month (= each month ).
sentences.chinese: 她每月约挣350英镑。

sentences.english: We update the schedule at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

name: monthly
trans: adj. 每月的，每月一次的；有效期为一个月的

sentences.english: The mortgage is payable in monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款每月分期偿还。

sentences.english: a monthly publication
sentences.chinese: 月刊

sentences.english: In some areas the property price can rise monthly.
sentences.chinese: 有些地区，房价能每月都涨。

sentences.english: They meet monthly to discuss progress.
sentences.chinese: 他们每月碰一次头讨论进展情况。

sentences.english: a leading women’s monthly
sentences.chinese: 一本主要的女性月刊

detailed_translations.english: happening once a month
every month or once a month
a magazine that appears once a month

name: more
trans: adv. 更多；此外；更大程度地

sentences.english: I have no more questions.
sentences.chinese: 我没问题了。

sentences.english: The film deserves more attention from the public.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片应受到公众的更多注意。

sentences.english: The accident taught him to be more careful.
sentences.chinese: 这起事故的教训使他变得更小心。

detailed_translations.english: a greater amount or number
having a particular quality to a greater degree

name: move
trans: n. 移动；步骤；迁居；策略

sentences.english: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.english: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

name: movement
trans: n. 运动；活动；运转；乐章

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: must
trans: aux. 必须，一定；可以，应当；很可能

sentences.english: All passengers must wear seat belts.
sentences.chinese: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。

sentences.english: It’s getting late. I really must go.
sentences.chinese: 天晚了，我真的必须走了。

sentences.english: You must work hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必须努力工作。

sentences.english: We must all be patient.
sentences.chinese: 我们都必须耐心。

sentences.english: Must I pay now?
sentences.chinese: 我必须现在付款吗？

sentences.english: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
sentences.chinese: 要启动引擎，绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。

sentences.english: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
sentences.chinese: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

detailed_translations.english: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order

name: nation
trans: n. 国家；民族；国民

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

name: national
trans: adj. 国家的；国民的；民族的；国立的

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

name: nature
trans: n. 自然；性质；本性；种类

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的；物质的；天生的；不做作的

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: naturally
trans: adv. 自然地

sentences.english: After a while, we naturally started talking about the children.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我们自然而然地谈起了孩子。

sentences.english: naturally occurring chemicals
sentences.chinese: 天然存在的化学物质

detailed_translations.english: in a way that you would expect

name: necessary
trans: adj. 必要的；必需的；必然的

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: necessarily
trans: adv. 必要地；必定地，必然地

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

name: near
trans: adj. 近的；亲近的；近似的

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

name: nearly
trans: adv. 差不多，几乎；密切地

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

name: need
trans: n. 需要，要求；缺乏；必要之物

sentences.english: You don’t really need a car.
sentences.chinese: 你其实并不需要一辆车。

sentences.english: Plants need light in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要光才能存活。

sentences.english: The camcorder needs a new battery.
sentences.chinese: 这台摄像机需要一块新电池。

sentences.english: Are you sure that you have everything you need?
sentences.chinese: 你确定需要的都有了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them
to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them

name: neglect
trans: vt. 疏忽，忽视；忽略

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: never
trans: adv. 从未；决不

sentences.english: He’s never been to Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他从未去过澳大利亚。

sentences.english: I’m never going back there again, not as long as I live.
sentences.chinese: 只要我活着，我再也不会回到那儿去。

sentences.english: It is never too late to give up smoking.
sentences.chinese: 戒烟不言晚。

sentences.english: (= never after a particular time ) would he return to Naples.
sentences.chinese: 他再也不会回到那不勒斯。

detailed_translations.english: not at any time, or not once

name: new
trans: adj. 新的，新鲜的；更新的；初见的

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

name: nice
trans: adj. 精密的；美好的；细微的；和蔼的

sentences.english: They’ve got a very nice house.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房子真漂亮。

sentences.english: Did you have a nice time?
sentences.chinese: 你们玩得开心吗？

sentences.english: It’s such a nice day (= good weather ), why not go for a swim?
sentences.chinese: 天气真好，为什么不去游泳呢？

sentences.english: What a nice surprise!
sentences.chinese: 真是个惊喜！

sentences.english: One of the nice things about Christmas is having all the family together.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节的一个好处是全家可以聚首一堂。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant, attractive, or enjoyable

name: nicely
trans: adv. 漂亮地；恰好地；精细地

sentences.english: a nicely calculated distance
sentences.chinese: 精确计算出的距离

detailed_translations.english: exactly or carefully

name: normal
trans: adj. 正常的；正规的，标准的

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: normally
trans: adv. 正常地；通常地，一般地

sentences.english: The journey normally takes about two hours.
sentences.chinese: 这段旅程通常需要大约两小时。

sentences.english: Normally, I park behind the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 通常我把车停在剧院后面。

sentences.english: The system seems to be working normally now.
sentences.chinese: 目前该系统似乎运行正常。

detailed_translations.english: usually

name: note
trans: n. 笔记；音符；票据；注解；纸币；便笺；照会；调子

sentences.english: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。

sentences.english: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
sentences.chinese: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条，但又决定还是打电话给她。

sentences.english: The notes are at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 注解在书末。

detailed_translations.english: something that you write down to remind you of something

name: notice
trans: n. 通知，布告；注意；公告

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

name: observant
trans: adj. 善于观察的；机警的；严格遵守的

sentences.english: a quiet and observant person
sentences.chinese: 一个寡言而机敏的人

sentences.english: Supervisors are trained to be observant.
sentences.chinese: 主管被训练得敏锐机警。

sentences.english: the writer’s observant eye for detail
sentences.chinese: 这位作家善于捕捉细节的敏锐目光

detailed_translations.chinese: 善于观察的；机警的；严格遵守的
detailed_translations.english: good or quick at noticing things

name: observe
trans: vt. 庆祝

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: occasionally
trans: adv. 偶尔；间或

sentences.english: Occasionally Alice would look up from her books.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯偶尔会从书中抬起头来。

name: occasional
trans: adj. 偶然的；临时的；特殊场合的

sentences.english: He made occasional visits to London.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

name: old
trans: adj. 陈旧的，古老的；年老的

sentences.english: an old man
sentences.chinese: 一位老人

sentences.english: How old are you?
sentences.chinese: 你多大年纪？

sentences.english: Are you older than Sally?
sentences.chinese: 你比萨莉大吗？

sentences.english: You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经长大，可以自己弄早餐了。

sentences.english: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
sentences.chinese: 我不去玩溜冰，我现在太老玩不动了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

name: once
trans: adv. 一次；曾经

sentences.english: I’ve only met her once.
sentences.chinese: 我只见过她一面。

sentences.english: Paul’s been to Wexford once before.
sentences.chinese: 保罗曾去过韦克斯福德一次。

detailed_translations.english: on one occasion only
from the time when something happens

name: opportunity
trans: n. 时机，机会

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

name: opposite
trans: adj. 相反的；对面的；对立的

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: order
trans: n. 命令；顺序；规则；[贸易] 定单

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

name: ordinary
trans: adj. 普通的；平凡的；平常的

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

name: ordinarily
trans: adv. 通常地；一般地

sentences.english: Ordinarily, he didn’t like to go to the movies.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说他不喜欢去看电影。

sentences.english: This is not the price at which the CD is ordinarily sold.
sentences.chinese: 这不是这张CD平时卖的价格。

detailed_translations.english: usually

name: original
trans: n. 原件；原作；原物；原型

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: originally
trans: adv. 最初，起初；本来

sentences.english: The family originally came from France.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族最初来自法国。

sentences.english: The building was originally used as a prison.
sentences.chinese: 这幢建筑最初用作监狱。

sentences.english: We originally intended to stay for just a few days.
sentences.chinese: 我们原先打算只逗留几天。

sentences.english: Originally, we had planned a tour of Scotland but we didn’t go in the end.
sentences.chinese: 起先我们计划到苏格兰旅游，但最后没有成行。

detailed_translations.english: in the beginning, before other things happened or before other things changed

name: origin
trans: n. 起源；原点；出身；开端

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: other
trans: adj. 其他的，另外的

sentences.english: The other hotels are all full.
sentences.chinese: 其他的宾馆均已客满。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

name: ourselves
trans: pron. 我们自己；我们亲自

sentences.english: We prepared ourselves for the long journey ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我们为将要开始的长途旅行做好了准备。

sentences.english: It was strange seeing ourselves on television.
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看到自己感觉很奇怪。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking to show that they and one or more other people are affected by their own action

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，结局；成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: outside
trans: adj. 外面的，外部的；外来的

sentences.english: The outside of the house was painted white.
sentences.chinese: 这房子的外墙刷成了白色。

sentences.english: Outside observers said the election was free and fair.
sentences.chinese: 外部观察员说此次选举自由而公正。

detailed_translations.english: the part or surface of something that is furthest from the centre
involving people who do not belong to the same group or organization as you

name: over
trans: adv. 结束；越过；从头到尾

sentences.english: Will you be home over the summer vacation?
sentences.chinese: 暑假期间你在家吗？

sentences.english: Over a period of ten years he stole a million pounds from the company.
sentences.chinese: 他在10年间从公司偷走了100万英镑。

sentences.english: Can we talk about this over dinner?
sentences.chinese: 我们能否边吃饭边谈这个问题？

detailed_translations.english: during

name: own
trans: vt. 拥有；承认

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: owner
trans: n. [经] 所有者；物主

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: pain
trans: n. 疼痛；努力

sentences.english: The pain is getting worse.
sentences.chinese: 疼得越来越厉害了。

sentences.english: Greg was in a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 格雷格疼痛万分。

sentences.english: the pleasures and pains of growing old
sentences.chinese: 变老的苦与乐

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when part of your body hurts

name: painful
trans: adj. 痛苦的；疼痛的；令人不快的

sentences.english: stiff painful joints
sentences.chinese: 僵硬疼痛的关节

sentences.english: Is your arm very painful?
sentences.chinese: 你的手臂很疼吗？

sentences.english: The neck becomes swollen and painful to the touch (= hurts when you touch it ) .
sentences.chinese: 脖子肿起来了，一碰就疼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛苦的，疼痛的，令人不快的
detailed_translations.english: if a part of your body is painful, it hurts

name: pair
trans: n. 一对，一双，一副

sentences.english: earrings, £5 a pair
sentences.chinese: 耳环，5英镑一副

sentences.english: We were each paired with a newcomer to help with training.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人都和一名新手组对，帮助他们训练。

detailed_translations.english: two things of the same type that are used together
to put people or things into groups of two, or to form groups of two

name: part
trans: n. 部分；角色；零件；一些；片段

sentences.english: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

sentences.english: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
sentences.chinese: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

name: partner
trans: n. 伙伴；合伙人；配偶

sentences.english: Discuss your worries with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 和伴侣谈谈你的忧虑。

sentences.english: Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners .
sentences.chinese: 只有29%的单身家长得到他们前配偶的经济资助。

sentences.english: Clare’s my tennis partner.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔是我的网球搭档。

sentences.english: Take your partners for the next dance.
sentences.chinese: 挑选下一支舞的舞伴吧。

detailed_translations.english: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship

name: past
trans: n. 过去；往事

sentences.english: Judging by her past performance, Jane should do very well.
sentences.chinese: 从以往的表现来看，简应该会干得很好。

sentences.english: From past experience she knew that it was no use arguing with him.
sentences.chinese: 根据过去的经验，她知道和他争论是没有用的。

sentences.english: Study some past exam papers to get an idea of the questions.
sentences.chinese: 仔细看看以前的一些考卷，了解一下考题。

sentences.english: It’s time she stopped living in the past (= thinking only about the past ) and began to think about her future.
sentences.chinese: 她不该再沉湎过去，应开始想想将来。

detailed_translations.english: done, used, or experienced before now
the time that existed before the present

name: path
trans: n. 道路；小路；轨道

sentences.english: I walked nervously up the garden path towards the front door.
sentences.chinese: 我提心吊胆地沿着花园的小道向前门走去。

sentences.english: a well-worn path across the grass
sentences.chinese: 草地上被踏出的小径

sentences.english: Follow the path along the river to the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 沿着河边的小路走到那座桥。

sentences.english: a path leading to the summer house
sentences.chinese: 通往避暑别墅的小径

detailed_translations.english: a track that has been made deliberately or made by many people walking over the same ground

name: pave
trans: vt. 铺设；安排；作铺设之用

sentences.english: a paved courtyard
sentences.chinese: 地面铺砌过的院子

detailed_translations.english: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or  concrete

name: pay
trans: n. 工资，薪水；付款；报答

sentences.english: How would you like to pay?
sentences.chinese: 你想怎么付款？

detailed_translations.english: to give someone money for something you buy or for a service

name: payment
trans: n. 付款，支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

name: perform
trans: vt. 执行；完成；演奏

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: performance
trans: n. 性能；绩效；表演；执行；表现

sentences.english: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的演出8点开始。

sentences.english: the performance of his official duties
sentences.chinese: 履行他的职务

sentences.english: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。

detailed_translations.english: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

name: person
trans: n. 人；身体；容貌，外表；人称

sentences.english: He was a very nice person, always pleasant and friendly.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很好的人，始终彬彬有礼。

sentences.english: The only person who really said anything helpful was Jack.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个人真正说了些有用的话，就是杰克。

sentences.english: I like her as a person , but not as a boss.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢她这个人，但作为老板我就不喜欢了。

sentences.english: I still know quite a lot of people in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然认识村里的很多人。

sentences.english: a group of young people
sentences.chinese: 一群年轻人

sentences.english: You have to sign for it in person.
sentences.chinese: 你必须亲自签收。

detailed_translations.english: a human being, especially considered as someone with their own particular character

name: personal
trans: n. 人事消息栏；人称代名词

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

name: personality
trans: n. 个性；品格；名人

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

name: physical
trans: n. 体格检查

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: physically
trans: adv. 身体上，身体上地

sentences.english: She is young and physically fit.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻而且身体健康。

sentences.english: Do you find him physically attractive?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得他长得帅吗？

sentences.english: I felt physically sick at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 一想到那个我就觉得身体不舒服。

sentences.english: children who have been physically abused
sentences.chinese: 身体受到虐待的儿童

detailed_translations.english: in relation to your body rather than your mind or emotions

name: pity
trans: n. 怜悯，同情；遗憾

sentences.english: It’s a great pity Joyce wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯没有受到邀请太遗憾了。

sentences.english: I like Charlie. Pity he had to marry that awful woman.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢查利，遗憾的是他得和那个糟糕的女人结婚。

sentences.english: A pity we can’t find the guy who did it.
sentences.chinese: 真遗憾我们找不到那个干了这件事的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are disappointed about something and you wish things could happen differently

detailed_translations.chinese: 对……表示怜悯；对……感到同情
detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation

name: play
trans: n. 游戏；比赛；剧本

sentences.english: Kids were playing and chasing each other.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在互相追逐嬉闹。

sentences.english: He’s learning to play the piano.
sentences.chinese: 他在学习弹钢琴。

detailed_translations.english: when children play, they do things that they enjoy, often with other people or with toys

name: player
trans: n. 运动员，比赛者；游戏者，做游戏的人；演奏者，表演者；演员；播放器

sentences.english: a game for four players
sentences.chinese: 四人玩的游戏

sentences.english: a tennis/rugby/chess, etc. player
sentences.chinese: 网球、橄榄球、国际象棋等选手

detailed_translations.english: a person who takes part in a game or sport

name: pleasant
trans: adj. 令人愉快的，舒适的；讨人喜欢的，和蔼可亲的

sentences.english: It had been a pleasant evening.
sentences.chinese: 那是个愉快的夜晚。

sentences.english: the pleasant climate of Southern California
sentences.chinese: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候

sentences.english: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。

sentences.english: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
sentences.chinese: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

detailed_translations.english: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy

name: pleasure
trans: n. 快乐；希望；娱乐；令人高兴的事

sentences.english: She sipped her drink with obvious pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 她小口抿着喝饮料，显然很高兴

sentences.english: the simple pleasures of life
sentences.chinese: 生活中的简单乐趣

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction that you get from an experience

name: politician
trans: n. 政治家，政客

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: political
trans: 政治的

name: pollution
trans: n. 污染

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

name: pollute
trans: vt. 污染；玷污；败坏

sentences.english: beaches polluted by raw sewage
sentences.chinese: 受未经处理的污水污染的海滩

sentences.english: The factory pollutes the air and water.
sentences.chinese: 那家工厂污染了空气和水。

detailed_translations.english: to make air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use

name: poorly
trans: adj. 身体不舒服的；心情恶劣的

sentences.english: Matt’s wife’s been very poorly.
sentences.chinese: 马特的妻子身体一直不好。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is poorly, they are ill

name: popular
trans: adj. 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: popularly
trans: adv. 流行地；通俗地；普及地；大众地

sentences.english: ...the Mesozoic era, more popularly known as the age of dinosaurs.
sentences.chinese: …中生代，俗称恐龙时代。

sentences.english: ...an infection popularly called mad cow disease.
sentences.chinese: …俗称疯牛病的一种传染病。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone is popularly known as something, most people call them that, although it is not their official name or title

name: popularity
trans: n. 普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: portion
trans: n. 部分；一份；命运

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: positive
trans: n. 正数；[摄] 正片

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: positively
trans: adv. 肯定地；明确地；断然地；乐观地

sentences.english: Some holiday destinations are positively dangerous .
sentences.chinese: 有些度假地真的很危险。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is true, especially when this seems surprising

name: possible
trans: n. 可能性；合适的人；可能的事物

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: possibly
trans: adv. 可能地；也许；大概

sentences.english: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。

sentences.english: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
sentences.chinese: 要花三个星期，也许更久。

sentences.english: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
sentences.chinese: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”

sentences.english: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly (= it is very likely ) .’
sentences.chinese: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain

name: potential
trans: n. 潜能；可能性；[电] 电势

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: potentially
trans: adv. 可能地，潜在地

sentences.english: a potentially dangerous situation
sentences.chinese: 有潜在危险的局势

detailed_translations.english: something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future

name: pour
trans: n. 倾泻；流出；骤雨

sentences.english: She poured coffee for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

name: power
trans: n. 力量，能力；电力，功率；政权，势力；[数] 幂

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: powerful
trans: adj. 强大的；强有力的

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: practise
trans: vi. 练习，实践；实施，实行；从事

sentences.english: They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。

sentences.english: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
sentences.chinese: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: probable
trans: n. 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者

sentences.english: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
sentences.chinese: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。

sentences.english: Success is highly probable .
sentences.chinese: 成功的希望相当大。

detailed_translations.english: likely to exist, happen, or be true

detailed_translations.chinese: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc

name: probably
trans: adv. 大概；或许；很可能

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: problem
trans: n. 难题；引起麻烦的人

sentences.english: She was older than me, but that wasn’t really a problem.
sentences.chinese: 她比我年长，不过那不算什么问题。

sentences.english: She gave us 20 mathematical problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 她让我们解20道数学题。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that causes difficulties

name: procedure
trans: n. 程序，手续；步骤

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: process
trans: n. 过程，进行；方法，步骤；作用；程序；推移

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: produce
trans: n. 农产品，产品

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: producer
trans: n. 制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器

sentences.english: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
sentences.chinese: …沙特阿拉伯，世界上最重要的石油生产国。

sentences.english: Hollywood producers and movie stars
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

name: profession
trans: n. 职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。
