sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: professor
trans: n. 教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: prompt
trans: n. 提示；付款期限；DOS命令：改变DOS系统提示符的风格

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: protection
trans: n. 保护；防卫；护照

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: provide
trans: vt. 提供；规定；准备；装备

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: public
trans: n. 公众；社会；公共场所

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: push
trans: n. 推，决心；大规模攻势；矢志的追求

sentences.english: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
sentences.chinese: 它一动不动，因此她加力去推。

sentences.english: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。

sentences.english: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
sentences.chinese: 推着购物车的购物者

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

name: qualify
trans: vi. 取得资格，有资格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: qualified
trans: 有资格的

name: quality
trans: n. 质量，[统计] 品质；特性；才能

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: quick
trans: n. 核心；伤口的嫩肉

sentences.english: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
sentences.chinese: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。

sentences.english: It’s probably quicker by train.
sentences.chinese: 乘火车可能会快一点。

sentences.english: Have we got time for a quick drink?
sentences.chinese: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？

sentences.english: What’s the quickest way to the station?
sentences.chinese: 到车站怎么走最快？

sentences.english: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
sentences.chinese: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。

sentences.english: Three bombs went off in quick succession (= quickly, one after the other ).
sentences.chinese: 瞬间有三个炸弹连续爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: lasting for or taking only a short time

name: quickly
trans: adv. 迅速地；很快地

sentences.english: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须尽快完成此事。

sentences.english: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
sentences.chinese: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

detailed_translations.english: fast

name: rate
trans: n. 比率，率；速度；价格；等级

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: rather
trans: adv. 宁可，宁愿；相当

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

name: reach
trans: n. 范围；延伸；河段；横风行驶

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

name: real
trans: n. 现实；实数

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: really
trans: adv. 实际上，事实上；真正地，真实地；真的吗？（表语气）

sentences.english: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？

sentences.english: Oliver’s not really her brother.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。

sentences.english: I never know what he’s really thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。

sentences.english: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
sentences.chinese: 一开始她似乎并不友善，但其实她人很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 真正地， 实际上； 很， 十分， 全然
detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

name: reality
trans: n. 现实；实际；真实

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recommendation
trans: n. 推荐；建议；推荐信

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: relate
trans: vt. 叙述；使…有联系

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: related
trans: v. 叙述（relate过去式）

name: rely
trans: vi. 依靠；信赖

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: reliance
trans: n. 信赖；信心；受信赖的人或物

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: reliable
trans: n. 可靠的人

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: receive
trans: vt. 收到；接待；接纳

sentences.english: All the children will receive a small gift.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.english: Lee received 324 votes (= 324 people voted for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

sentences.english: If you would like to receive further information , return the attached form.
sentences.chinese: 欲收到详细资料，请交回所附表格。

sentences.english: She isn’t well enough to receive visitors yet.
sentences.chinese: 她身体还不是很好，不能见客。

detailed_translations.english: to be given something

name: remember
trans: vi. 记得，记起

sentences.english: Do you remember Rosa Davies?
sentences.chinese: 你记得罗莎·戴维斯吗？

sentences.english: I can’t remember her exact words.
sentences.chinese: 我记不得她的原话了。

sentences.english: I remember it well ; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我记得很清楚；我从未见过母亲这么生气。

sentences.english: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
sentences.chinese: 她清楚地记得他们登上火车时的激动心情。

sentences.english: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约记得在报纸上看到过有关情况。

sentences.english: They had three children, if I remember rightly .
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错，他们有三个孩子。

sentences.english: You left your keys on the table, remember?
sentences.chinese: 你把钥匙放在桌子上了，想起来了吗？

sentences.english: I hope he remembers the wine.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他记得带酒。

detailed_translations.english: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past

name: renew
trans: vt. 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: renewable
trans: n. 再生性能源

sentences.english: It’s a six-month lease but it’s renewable.
sentences.chinese: 租期六个月，但是可以续签。

sentences.english: a renewable visa
sentences.chinese: 可延期的签证

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement or official document is renewable, you can make it continue for a further period of time after it ends

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: require
trans: vt. 需要；要求；命令

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: researcher
trans: n. 研究员

sentences.english: The Cloud Mouse is a project of Microsoft researcher Richard Harper and his collaborators at Microsoft Research Asia.
sentences.chinese: 云鼠标是微软研究员理查德哈珀和他的合作者在微软亚洲研究院的一个项目 。

sentences.english: Let me just conclude this post by saying, our passion for search is stronger than ever - and as a search researcher, I have the best job in the world :-).
sentences.chinese: 在这篇帖子结束的时候我想说，我们对搜索的热情比任何时候都强烈-作为一个搜索研究员，我有世界上最好的工作:)。

name: resent
trans: vt. 怨恨；愤恨；厌恶

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: respond
trans: n. 应答；唱和

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: response
trans: n. 响应；反应；回答

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: rewarding
trans: adj. 有益的，值得的；有报酬的，报答的

sentences.english: Teaching can be a very rewarding career.
sentences.chinese: 教书可以是一种很有意义的职业。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel happy and satisfied because you feel you are doing something useful or important, even if you do not earn much money

name: reward
trans: n. [劳经] 报酬；报答；酬谢

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: ridicule
trans: n. 嘲笑；笑柄；愚弄

sentences.english: the ridicule of his peers
sentences.chinese: 他同龄人的奚落

sentences.english: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.chinese: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

detailed_translations.english: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid

name: risk
trans: n. 风险；危险；冒险

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: risky
trans: adj. 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的

sentences.english: Doctors say it’s too risky to try and operate.
sentences.chinese: 医生说动手术风险太大。

sentences.english: Buying a secondhand car is a risky business .
sentences.chinese: 买二手汽车是有风险的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的
detailed_translations.english: involving a risk that something bad will happen

name: role
trans: n. 角色；任务

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

name: rough
trans: n. 艰苦；高低不平的地面；未经加工的材料；粗糙的部分

sentences.english: Her hands were rough from hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。

sentences.english: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形

sentences.english: We were bumping over the rough ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

sentences.english: a rough translation
sentences.chinese: 粗略的翻译

detailed_translations.english: having an uneven surface

name: roughly
trans: adv. 粗糙地；概略地

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

sentences.english: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

detailed_translations.english: not exactly

name: sadness
trans: n. 悲哀

sentences.english: There was a touch of sadness in his voice (= he sounded a little sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的声音里含着一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: His relief was tinged with sadness (= he also felt rather sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的欣慰中带着一丝哀伤。

detailed_translations.english: the state of feeling sad

name: asd
trans: asd

name: safe
trans: n. 保险箱；冷藏室；纱橱

sentences.english: She doesn’t feel safe in the house on her own.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人在家感到不安全。

sentences.english: Make sure you keep these documents safe .
sentences.chinese: 你一定要妥善保管这些文件。

detailed_translations.english: not in danger of being harmed, lost, or stolen
a strong metal box or cupboard with special locks where you keep money and valuable things

name: safety
trans: n. 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打

sentences.english: You shouldn’t travel alone, for safety’s sake .
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，不要独自一人旅行。

sentences.english: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
sentences.chinese: 为了您自身的安全，请不要在飞机上吸烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

name: same
trans: adj. 相同的；同一的；上述的（通常与the连用）；无变化的

sentences.english: Her perfume has always had the same effect on me.
sentences.chinese: 她身上的香水给我的感觉一如既往。

sentences.english: He’s the same old Peter – moody and irritable.
sentences.chinese: 他还是以前那个彼得——喜怒无常且爱发火。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相同的；同一的；上述的（通常与the连用）；无变化的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样的事物或人（通常与the连用）
detailed_translations.english: used to say that two or more people or things are exactly like each other
in the same way

name: save
trans: prep. 除...之外

sentences.english: We’ll save a lot of time if we go by car.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是开车去，可以节省很多时间。

sentences.english: Everyone is being encouraged to save energy.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都被鼓励节约能源。

sentences.english: ways to save money on heating bills
sentences.chinese: 节省取暖费的种种办法

detailed_translations.english: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any

name: say
trans: vt. 讲；说明；例如；声称；假设；指明

sentences.english: ‘I’m so tired,’ she said.
sentences.chinese: “我太累了。”她说。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t cry,’ he said softly.
sentences.chinese: “别哭了。”他柔声说道。

sentences.english: Don’t believe anything he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说什么都不要相信。

sentences.english: I always said I would buy a motorbike when I had enough money.
sentences.chinese: 我一直说等我有了足够的钱就买一辆摩托车。

sentences.english: I would like to say how much we appreciate your hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我想说我们对你的辛勤劳动非常感谢。

sentences.english: ‘Why did she leave?’ ‘I don’t know – she didn’t say .’
sentences.chinese: “她为什么要离开？”“我不知道——她没说。”

sentences.english: Although he didn’t say so , it was clear that he was in pain.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他没说，但是他明显很痛苦。

sentences.english: (= why do you think that ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会那么说呢？

sentences.english: I’d like to say a few words (= make a short speech ) .
sentences.chinese: 我想简单地说几句。

sentences.english: ‘So what are your plans now?’‘ I’d rather not say .’
sentences.chinese: “那么你现在的计划是什么？”“我还是不说的好。”

detailed_translations.english: to express an idea, feeling, thought etc using words

name: scene
trans: n. 场面；情景；景象；事件

sentences.english: Hamlet, Act 5 Scene 2
sentences.chinese: 《哈姆雷特》第5幕第2场

sentences.english: battle scenes
sentences.chinese: 战斗场面

sentences.english: The police soon arrived at the scene of the crime .
sentences.chinese: 警察很快就到达了案发现场。

sentences.english: He photographed a wide range of street scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他拍下了丰富多彩的街景。

detailed_translations.english: part of a play during which there is no change in time or place

name: seem
trans: vi. 似乎；像是；装作

sentences.english: Ann didn’t seem very sure.
sentences.chinese: 安看来并不十分肯定。

sentences.english: It seems a foolish decision now.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来这是一个愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: It seems like you’re catching a cold, Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 你好像感冒了，泰勒。

sentences.english: ‘So Bill’s leaving her?’ ‘ So it seems (= that seems to be true ) .’
sentences.chinese: “这么说来，比尔要离开她？”“好像是这样。”

detailed_translations.english: if something seems to be true, there are qualities or facts that make people think it is true

name: sell
trans: n. 销售；失望；推销术

sentences.english: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再加一百元钱，我想他会卖的。

sentences.english: He regrets selling all his old records.
sentences.chinese: 他后悔把所有的老唱片都卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone in exchange for money

name: resell
trans: vt. 转售；转卖；再卖

name: series
trans: n. 系列，连续；[电] 串联；级数；丛书

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: serve
trans: n. 发球，轮到发球

sentences.english: There was only one girl serving customers .
sentences.chinese: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 招待，供应；为…服务；对…有用；可作…用
detailed_translations.english: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
the action in a game such as tennis or  volleyball  when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

name: set
trans: n. [数] 集合；一套；布景；[机] 装置

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: several
trans: adj. 几个的；各自的

sentences.english: I have several suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个建议。

sentences.english: I have several methods.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个方法。

sentences.english: I have several reasons to support my view.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个理由来支持我的观点。

name: share
trans: n. 份额；股份

sentences.english: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

name: should
trans: aux. 应该；就；可能；将要

sentences.english: He shouldn’t be so selfish.
sentences.chinese: 他不该这么自私。

sentences.english: Why should anyone want to marry Tony?
sentences.chinese: 怎么竟然会有人意嫁给托尼？

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is the right or sensible thing to do

name: show
trans: n. 显示；表演；炫耀

sentences.english: Think positively and show some determination.
sentences.chinese: 要往好的方面想，拿出决心来。

sentences.english: She had learned not to show her emotions .
sentences.chinese: 她早就学会了不流露出自己的感情。

sentences.english: It was the sound a man might make when in pain but trying not to show it.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个人强忍着疼痛不愿表露出来时发出的声音。

sentences.english: Mary showed great interest in the children.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽对这些小孩子表示出极大的兴趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 显现， 显露， 露面； 演出， 放映
detailed_translations.english: to let your feelings, attitudes, or personal qualities be clearly seen

detailed_translations.chinese: 表演，节目；演出，上映；展览，展览物，展览会；显示，展示；表面，外观
detailed_translations.english: a performance for the public, especially one that includes singing, dancing, or jokes

detailed_translations.chinese: 给看，显示，出示；引领，带领；教，告知，说明；表明，证明
detailed_translations.english: to let someone see something

name: sight
trans: n. 视力；景象；眼界；见解

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

name: silence
trans: n. 沉默；寂静；缄默；不谈；无声状态

sentences.english: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
sentences.chinese: 沉默了片刻才有人回答。

sentences.english: ‘Silence in court!’ roared the judge.
sentences.chinese: “法庭上请保持肃静！”法官吼道。

sentences.english: The accused exercised his right to silence (= the legal right to choose to say nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 被告行使了沉默权。

sentences.english: She held up her hand to silence the children.
sentences.chinese: 她抬手示意孩子们安静下来。

detailed_translations.english: complete quiet because nobody is talking
to make someone stop talking, or stop something making a noise

name: similar
trans: n. 类似物

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: similarly
trans: adv. 同样地；类似于

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

sentences.english: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
sentences.chinese: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地，燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

detailed_translations.english: in a similar way

name: since
trans: conj. 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

name: situation
trans: n. 情况；形势；处境；位置

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: size
trans: n. 大小；尺寸

sentences.english: He’s a small boy, about John’s size.
sentences.chinese: 他是个小男孩，个子和约翰差不多。

sentences.english: Jensens’ house is about the same size as ours.
sentences.chinese: 詹森的房子和我们的差不多大。

sentences.english: He’s quite a big dog, but he’s still not full size yet.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗体型很大，但还没有长足。

detailed_translations.english: how big or small something is
to sort according to size

name: skill
trans: n. 技能，技巧；本领，技术

sentences.english: Reading and writing are two different skills.
sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.english: Many jobs today require computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

name: skilled
trans: 熟练的

name: slender
trans: adj. 细长的；苗条的；微薄的

sentences.english: She is slender and stylish.
sentences.chinese: 她身材修长，穿着时髦。

sentences.english: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: thin in an attractive or graceful way

name: so
trans: conj. 所以；因此

sentences.english: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
sentences.chinese: 在接到命令之前，部队不会前进。

sentences.english: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
sentences.chinese: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话，那钱到哪里去了？

sentences.english: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
sentences.chinese: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”

sentences.english: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
sentences.chinese: “瞧，我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”

sentences.english: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
sentences.chinese: 家长要是愿意，可以让孩子退学。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated

name: solve
trans: vt. 解决；解答；溶解

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

name: solution
trans: n. 解决方案；溶液；溶解；解答

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

name: something
trans: n. 重要的人；值得重视的事

sentences.english: There’s something in my eye.
sentences.chinese: 我眼睛里有什么东西。

sentences.english: Sarah said something about coming over later.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉说她等一会儿过来什么的。

sentences.english: I don’t know what he does exactly, but I know it has something to do with computers (= is related to them in some way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他具体是干什么的，只知道和电脑有关。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean a particular thing when you do not know its name or do not know exactly what it is

detailed_translations.chinese: 重要的人；值得重视的事

name: song
trans: n. 歌曲；歌唱；诗歌；鸣声

sentences.english: We used to listen to pop songs on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我们以前常常听收音机里播放的流行歌曲。

sentences.english: They sat round with guitars, singing folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 他们弹着吉他围坐在一起唱民歌。

sentences.english: ...dance, music, mime, and song.
sentences.chinese: …舞蹈、音乐、哑剧和歌唱。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of music with words that you sing

name: southern
trans: n. 南方人

sentences.english: a southern accent
sentences.chinese: 南部口音

sentences.english: Southern Italy
sentences.chinese: 意大利南部

detailed_translations.english: in or from the south of a country or area

name: south
trans: 南方

name: special
trans: n. 特使，特派人员；特刊；特色菜；专车；特价商品

sentences.english: a special place in the classroom for reading
sentences.chinese: 教室里的阅读专区

sentences.english: No one receives special treatment.
sentences.chinese: 没有人享有特殊待遇。

sentences.english: Maria’s special recipe for apple pie
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚的苹果馅饼秘方

sentences.english: The good china was used only on special occasions .
sentences.chinese: 这些精美瓷器只在特殊场合使用。

sentences.english: Each village has its own special charm.
sentences.chinese: 每一座村子都有其独特的魅力。

detailed_translations.english: not ordinary or usual, but different in some way and often better or more important

name: specially
trans: 特别地

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: spirit
trans: n. 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

name: spiritually
trans: 精神上的

name: standard
trans: n. 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

name: start
trans: 开始

name: stay
trans: n. 逗留；停止；支柱

sentences.english: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
sentences.chinese: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

sentences.english: She stayed late to finish the report.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成报告，她工作到很晚。

detailed_translations.english: to remain in a place rather than leave
a limited time of living in a place

name: stop
trans: 停止

name: stress
trans: n. 压力；强调；紧张；重要性；重读

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

name: strong
trans: 坚强的

name: strongly
trans: adv. 强有力地；坚强地；激烈地；气味浓地

sentences.english: I’m strongly opposed to capital punishment.
sentences.chinese: 我坚决反对死刑。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is meant to persuade someone to do something

name: study
trans: n. 学习，研究；课题；书房；学问

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: stupid
trans: 愚蠢的

name: successful
trans: adj. 成功的；一帆风顺的

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: succeed
trans: 达到目的

name: success
trans: n. 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: successfully
trans: adv. 成功地；顺利地

name: such
trans: 这样的

name: suffer
trans: vi. 遭受，忍受；受痛苦；经验；受损害

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: suit
trans: n. 诉讼；恳求；套装，西装；一套外衣

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: suitable
trans: 合适的

name: supply
trans: n. 供给，补给；供应品

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: supplier
trans: 供应商

name: support
trans: n. 支持，维持；支援，供养；支持者，支撑物

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: sure
trans: adj. 确信的；可靠的；必定的

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

name: surprise
trans: 惊喜

name: surprised
trans: v. 使惊奇（surprise的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: He looked surprised to see Cassie standing by the front door.
sentences.chinese: 他看到卡西站在前门旁，显得很吃惊。

sentences.english: He had a surprised look on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他一脸惊讶。

sentences.english: Don’t be surprised if the interviewer is rather direct.
sentences.chinese: 如果采访的人说话比较直接，也不要吃惊。

sentences.english: I wouldn’t be surprised if she married that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 要是她嫁给那家伙，我不会感到意外。

detailed_translations.english: having a feeling of surprise

name: surprising
trans: v. 使惊奇；意外发现（surprise的ing形式）

sentences.english: She told me a surprising thing.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉我一件令人吃惊的事。

sentences.english: A surprising number of his paintings have survived.
sentences.chinese: 他的存世画作多得出奇。

sentences.english: It is hardly surprising that new mothers often suffer from depression.
sentences.chinese: 初为人母者常患上抑郁症是不足为奇的。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or unexpected

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊奇；意外发现（surprise的ing形式）

name: survive
trans: 幸存

name: survival
trans: n. 幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: system
trans: n. 制度，体制；系统；方法

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: take
trans: vi. 拿；获得

sentences.english: Will you take the job?
sentences.chinese: 你接受这份工作吗？

sentences.english: Do you take American Express?
sentences.chinese: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？

sentences.english: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听我的意见，就去看医生。

sentences.english: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls (= telephone calls ) a year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。

sentences.english: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
sentences.chinese: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。

sentences.english: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
sentences.chinese: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。

sentences.english: I just can’t take any more (= can’t deal with a bad situation any longer ) .
sentences.chinese: 我再也受不了了。

sentences.english: Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 员工同意接受2%的降薪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拿走； 接受， 接纳
detailed_translations.english: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you

name: talk
trans: n. 谈话；演讲；空谈

sentences.english: I could hear Sarah and Andy talking in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我听到萨拉和安迪在隔壁讲话。

sentences.english: Sue and Bob still aren’t talking (= are refusing to talk to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 休和鲍勃仍然互不理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to say things to someone as part of a conversation
to say things to someone as part of a conversation

name: technology
trans: 技术

name: technical
trans: 技术的

name: tend
trans: 倾向

name: terrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；很糟的；令人讨厌的

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: terribly
trans: adv. 非常；可怕地；极度地

sentences.english: I’m terribly sorry to have kept you waiting.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，让你久等了。

sentences.english: The coach was not terribly worried about his team’s poor performance.
sentences.chinese: 教练对他所执教球队的糟糕表现并不是十分担忧。

detailed_translations.english: very

name: thank
trans: n. 感谢

sentences.english: I haven’t had a chance to thank him yet.
sentences.chinese: 我还没有机会向他表示谢意。

sentences.english: They accepted their certificates with words of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 他们接过证书，同时表示了谢意。

sentences.english: They accepted their certificates with words of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 他们接过证书，同时表示了谢意。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have done, or to be polite about it
When you express your thanks to someone, you express your gratitude to them for something
When you express your thanks to someone, you express your gratitude to them for something

name: thankful
trans: adj. 感谢的；欣慰的

sentences.english: Most of the time I'm just thankful that I've got a job.
sentences.chinese: 大部分时候我庆幸自己有了份工作。

detailed_translations.english: grateful and glad about something that has happened, especially because without it the situation would be much worse

name: therefore
trans: adv. 因此；所以

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: think
trans: n. 想；想法

sentences.english: I thought I heard something.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我听到了什么声音。

sentences.english: He didn’t think anyone would believe him.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没人会相信他。

sentences.english: Do you think I should call him?
sentences.chinese: 你认为我应该打电话给他吗？

sentences.english: For some reason, I keep thinking it’s Friday today.
sentences.chinese: 不知为什么，我总觉得今天是周五。

sentences.english: The recession lasted longer than anyone thought it would.
sentences.chinese: 谁也没有想到这次经济萧条会持续这么久。

sentences.english: Am I right in thinking that you have a brother?
sentences.chinese: 我想你是有个兄弟的，对吗？

sentences.english: I can’t help thinking that he’s made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得他弄错了。

sentences.english: Do you honestly think I would do something so stupid?
sentences.chinese: 你真认为我会做这么愚蠢的事吗？

sentences.english: We must start thinking in terms of reducing costs.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须开始考虑降低成本了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular opinion or to believe that something is true
to think about a problem or question

name: thinking
trans: n. 思考；思想；想法；意见；见解

sentences.english: the thinking man’s pop band
sentences.chinese: 有思想的男士喜欢的流行乐队

detailed_translations.english: a thinking person is intelligent and tries to think carefully about important subjects
your opinion or ideas about something, or your attitude towards it

name: thought
trans: n. 思想；思考；想法；关心

sentences.english: It’s an interesting thought.
sentences.chinese: 这想法很有趣。

sentences.english: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
sentences.chinese: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think of, remember, or realize

detailed_translations.chinese: 想，思考；认为（think的过去式和过去分词）

name: thoughtful
trans: adj. 深思的；体贴的；关切的

sentences.english: Paul is very thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常体贴人。

sentences.english: a thoughtful look
sentences.chinese: 若有所思的神情

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of the things you can do to make people happy or comfortable

name: thoughtless
trans: 轻率的

name: threaten
trans: vt. 威胁；恐吓；预示

sentences.english: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪，他们就要罢工。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: threatening
trans: v. 威胁；恐吓；迫近（threaten的ing形式）

name: throughout
trans: prep. 贯穿，遍及

sentences.english: a large organization with offices throughout the world
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构

sentences.english: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。

sentences.english: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。

sentences.english: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。

detailed_translations.english: in every part of a particular area, place etc
during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

name: thus
trans: conj. 因此

sentences.english: Most of the evidence was destroyed in the fire. Thus it would be almost impossible to prove him guilty.
sentences.chinese: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁，因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

name: together
trans: adj. 新潮的；情绪稳定的，做事有效率的

sentences.english: We’ve very much enjoyed working together .
sentences.chinese: 我们在一起工作非常开心。

sentences.english: They’ve decided to spend more time together.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定要花更多时间在一起。

sentences.english: He and my father were at school together.
sentences.chinese: 他和我父亲一起上过学。

sentences.english: Together they went back inside the villa.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起回到了别墅里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一起；同时；相互；连续地；总共
detailed_translations.english: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的；情绪稳定的，做事有效率的

name: too
trans: adv. 太；也；很；还；非常；过度

sentences.english: Do you think the music’s too loud?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得音乐太响了吗？

sentences.english: You’ve put too much salt in the soup.
sentences.chinese: 你往汤里放盐太多。

sentences.english: There are too many cars on the road.
sentences.chinese: 路上车辆太多。

detailed_translations.english: more than is acceptable or possible

name: tool
trans: n. 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段

sentences.english: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
sentences.chinese: 我没有合适的工具来摆弄发动机。

sentences.english: a shop selling garden tools
sentences.chinese: 出售园艺工具的商店

detailed_translations.chinese: 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段
detailed_translations.english: something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用工具；用机床装备工厂

name: trade
trans: n. 贸易，交易；行业；职业

sentences.english: They had to travel into town to trade the produce from their farm.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不到镇上去出售他们农场的产品。

sentences.english: We traded necklaces.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换了项链。

detailed_translations.english: to buy and sell goods, services etc as your job or business

name: transport
trans: n. 运输；运输机；狂喜；流放犯

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: treat
trans: n. 请客；款待

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

name: treatment
trans: n. 治疗，疗法；处理；对待

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

name: trial
trans: n. 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: true
trans: 真的

name: truly
trans: adv. 真实地，不假；真诚地

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: truth
trans: n. 真理；事实；诚实；实质

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

sentences.english: The experience has taught us some basic truths.
sentences.chinese: 这次经历教会我们一些基本的道理。

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

detailed_translations.english: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

name: trust
trans: n. 信任，信赖；责任；托拉斯

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: try
trans: n. 尝试；努力；试验

sentences.english: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: turn
trans: n. 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止

sentences.english: Ricky turned and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.english: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ) , and stomped out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换
detailed_translations.english: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

name: unavoidable
trans: adj. 不可避免的；不能废除的

sentences.english: There are now fears that war is unavoidable.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在担心战争不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: impossible to prevent

name: unavoidably
trans: adv. 不可避免地；不得已地

sentences.english: The conflict of the class interests results in the pitiless class-struggle that unavoidably leads to the victory of the most numerous and most wronged class, the proletariat.
sentences.chinese: 阶级利益的冲突导致了无情的阶级斗争，从而不可避免地导致了最广大的、最受虐待的阶级，即无产阶级的胜利。

name: unclear
trans: adj. 不清楚的；不易了解的

sentences.english: The terms of the contract are very unclear.
sentences.chinese: 合同的条款非常含糊。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to understand or be sure about, so that there is doubt or confusion

name: uncomfortable
trans: adj. 不舒服的；不安的

sentences.english: This sofa is so uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这张沙发太不舒服了。

detailed_translations.english: not feeling physically comfortable, or not making you feel comfortable

name: under
trans: prep. 低于，少于；在...之下

sentences.english: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。

sentences.english: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
sentences.chinese: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。

sentences.english: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
sentences.chinese: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

sentences.english: He took a deep breath before he went under.
sentences.chinese: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。

detailed_translations.english: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

name: underneath
trans: prep. 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

name: understand
trans: vi. 理解；懂得；熟悉

sentences.english: She doesn’t understand English.
sentences.chinese: 她不懂英语。

sentences.english: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？

sentences.english: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
sentences.chinese: 那女人口音很重，我听不懂她在说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to know the meaning of what someone is telling you, or the language that they speak

name: understanding
trans: n. 谅解，理解；理解力；协议

sentences.english: Luckily, I have a very under­standing boss.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，我有一个非常通情达理的上司。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体谅的， 宽容的， 通情达理的
detailed_translations.english: sympathetic and kind about other people’s problems

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解，理解力；谅解；协议；相互理解，融洽
detailed_translations.english: an unofficial or informal agreement

name: uneasy
trans: 心神不安的

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业率；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: unnecessary
trans: adj. 不必要的；多余的，无用的

sentences.english: There’s no point in taking unnecessary risks.
sentences.chinese: 冒不必要的风险没什么意义。

sentences.english: We can’t afford any unnecessary delays.
sentences.chinese: 我们经不起无谓的耽搁。

sentences.english: Williams was found guilty of causing unnecessary suffering to animals.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯因无故虐待动物被判有罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不必要的；多余的，无用的
detailed_translations.english: not needed, or more than is needed

name: unpleasant
trans: adj. 讨厌的；使人不愉快的

sentences.english: an unpleasant experience
sentences.chinese: 不愉快的经历

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant smell
sentences.chinese: 极其难闻的味道

sentences.english: an unpleasant surprise
sentences.chinese: 令人不快的意外

detailed_translations.english: not pleasant or enjoyable

name: until
trans: prep. 在…以前；到…为止

sentences.english: The ticket is valid until March.
sentences.chinese: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。

sentences.english: He waited until she had finished speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他一直等到她讲完。

sentences.english: Until recently, Anna worked as a teacher in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近，安娜一直在日本当老师。

sentences.english: Up until last year, they didn’t even own a car.
sentences.chinese: 一直到去年，他们连汽车也没有。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time
if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time

name: unusual
trans: adj. 不寻常的；与众不同的；不平常的

sentences.english: an unusual feature
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的特点

sentences.english: unusual circumstances
sentences.chinese: 异常状况

sentences.english: It’s unusual for Dave to be late.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫迟到是很少见的。

sentences.english: (= it is quite common ) to feel very angry in a situation like this.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这样的情况觉得非常生气是很正常的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不平常的， 少有的； 独特的， 与众不同的
detailed_translations.english: different from what is usual or normal

name: up
trans: prep. 在…之上；向…的较高处

sentences.english: We walked slowly up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我们慢慢地爬上山。

sentences.english: She picked her jacket up off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她从地板上捡起外套。

sentences.english: paths leading up into the mountains
sentences.chinese: 通往山里的小径

sentences.english: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆爬到了树上，以便看得更清楚。

sentences.english: Put up your hand if you know the answer.
sentences.chinese: 如果知道答案就举手。

sentences.english: The water was getting up my nose.
sentences.chinese: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。

sentences.english: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦仰卧着，盯着天花板。

sentences.english: Are you sure you should be up?
sentences.chinese: 你肯定你该起床了吗?

sentences.english: These days they were up at the crack of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 这些天他们在破晓时就起床。

detailed_translations.english: towards a higher place or position
If you are up, you are not in bed

name: use
trans: n. 使用；用途；发挥

sentences.english: Can I use your phone?
sentences.chinese: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

sentences.english: I’ll show you which room you can use.
sentences.chinese: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。

sentences.english: I always use the same shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 我一直用同一种洗发水。

sentences.english: Use your imagination when planning meals.
sentences.chinese: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。

sentences.english: She booked the flight using a false name.
sentences.chinese: 她用化名预订了航班。

detailed_translations.english: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用， 应用； 用途， 效用
detailed_translations.english: the action or fact of using something

name: useful
trans: adj. 有用的，有益的；有帮助的

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

name: useless
trans: adj. 无用的；无效的

sentences.english: The editor killed a few useless lines.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删掉了几行无用的文字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
sentences.chinese: 请把无用的词划掉。

sentences.english: They wrote his suggestion off as a useless idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他的建议看做是无用的想法。

name: value
trans: n. 值；价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: valuable
trans: n. 贵重物品

name: vehicle
trans: n. [车辆] 车辆；工具；交通工具；运载工具；传播媒介；媒介物

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: wait
trans: n. 等待；等候

sentences.english: Hurry up! Everyone’s waiting.
sentences.chinese: 快点！大家在等着呢。

sentences.english: Would you mind waiting outside?
sentences.chinese: 你在外面等好吗？

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting ages.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经等了很长时间了。

detailed_translations.english: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
a period of time in which you wait for something to happen, someone to arrive etc

name: waiter
trans: n. 服务员，侍者

sentences.english: The waiter crumbed the table.
sentences.chinese: 服务员清除桌上的面包屑。

detailed_translations.english: a man who serves food and drink at the tables in a restaurant

name: wake
trans: n. 尾迹；守夜；守丧

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: warm
trans: n. 取暖；加热

sentences.english: The house was lovely and warm.
sentences.chinese: 那房子漂亮温暖。

sentences.english: I hope we get some warm weather soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望天气很快就会回暖。

sentences.english: I’ve put your dinner in the oven to keep it warm.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的饭菜放进了烤箱里保温。

sentences.english: warm water
sentences.chinese: 温水

detailed_translations.english: slightly hot, especially in a pleasant way
to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer

name: warmth
trans: n. 温暖；热情；激动

sentences.english: the warmth of the summer sun
sentences.chinese: 夏天太阳的暖意

sentences.english: the warmth of her smile
sentences.chinese: 她微笑中的热情

detailed_translations.english: the heat something produces, or when you feel warm

name: waste
trans: n. 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

name: wax
trans: n. 蜡；蜡状物

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

name: weak
trans: adj. [经] 疲软的；虚弱的；无力的；不牢固的

sentences.english: The illness left her feeling weak.
sentences.chinese: 疾病使她感到身体虚弱。

sentences.english: Poor light produces weak plants.
sentences.chinese: 光照不足，植物就生长不好。

sentences.english: The animal was weak from loss of blood.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物因失血而虚弱无力。

detailed_translations.chinese: [经] 疲软的；虚弱的；无力的；不牢固的
detailed_translations.english: not physically strong

name: weakness
trans: n. 弱点；软弱；嗜好

sentences.english: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
sentences.chinese: 这项立法有一个根本性缺陷。

sentences.english: The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划既有优点又有缺点。

sentences.english: muscular weakness
sentences.chinese: 肌无力

sentences.english: weakness in the economy
sentences.chinese: 经济疲软

detailed_translations.english: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc

name: weakly
trans: adj. 虚弱的；软弱的

name: wear
trans: n. 衣物；磨损；耐久性

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

name: whether
trans: 是否

name: while
trans: conj. 虽然；然而；当……的时候

sentences.english: They arrived while we were having dinner.
sentences.chinese: 他们来时我们正在吃饭。

sentences.english: While she was asleep, thieves broke in and stole her handbag.
sentences.chinese: 她睡着的时候，小偷闯进来偷走了她的手提包。

sentences.english: She met Andy while working on a production of Carmen.
sentences.chinese: 排练《卡门》时，她认识了安迪。

detailed_translations.english: during the time that something is happening
to spend time in a pleasant and lazy way

name: who
trans: pron. 谁；什么人

sentences.english: Who locked the door?
sentences.chinese: 谁锁的门？

sentences.english: Who do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你为谁工作？

sentences.english: Who’s that guy with your wife?
sentences.chinese: 和你妻子在一起的那个人是谁？

sentences.english: They never found out who the murderer was.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直未查出谁是凶犯。

sentences.english: She wondered who had sent the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是谁送的花。

detailed_translations.english: used to ask or talk about which person is involved, or what the name of a person is

name: whole
trans: n. 整体；全部

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you!
sentences.chinese: 你有一辈子要过呢！

sentences.english: His whole attitude bugs me.
sentences.chinese: 他的整个态度都让我讨厌。

sentences.english: We ate the whole cake in about ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 大约十分钟的时间，我们就把整个蛋糕都给吃完了。

sentences.english: The whole thing (= everything about the situation ) just makes me sick.
sentences.chinese: 这一切简直让我恶心。

sentences.english: We just sat around and watched TV the whole time (= the only thing we did was watch television ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一直都只是坐着看看电视。

sentences.english: I don’t believe she’s telling us the whole story (= all the facts ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为她没有告诉我们全部实情。

sentences.english: It was months before the whole truth came out.
sentences.chinese: 几个月以后才真相大白。

detailed_translations.english: all of something
something that consists of a number of parts, but is considered as a single unit

name: wise
trans: adj. 明智的；聪明的；博学的

sentences.english: a wise precaution
sentences.chinese: 明智的预防措施

sentences.english: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (= not be a sensible thing to do ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

detailed_translations.english: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

name: wisely
trans: adv. 明智地；聪明地；精明地

sentences.english: Sian had very wisely left the party before all the trouble started.
sentences.chinese: 沙恩很明智地在一切麻烦开始之前就离开了那个聚会。

sentences.english: Please use what you have wisely.
sentences.chinese: 请明智地花费你所拥有的。

detailed_translations.english: showing good judgment

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: within
trans: prep. 在…之内

sentences.english: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们24小时之内应该可以拿到化验结果。

sentences.english: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒了，不出几星期就死了。

sentences.english: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
sentences.chinese: 我们到达还没有一小时，卡罗琳就开始抱怨了。

sentences.english: The real dangers to these rebels came from within.
sentences.chinese: 对于这些叛乱分子真正的危险来自内部。

detailed_translations.english: before a certain period of time has passed
Within is also an adverb

name: without
trans: prep. 没有；超过；在…外面

sentences.english: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。

sentences.english: a house without a garden
sentences.chinese: 不带花园的房子

sentences.english: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
sentences.chinese: 我们路过两座破落的寺院，一座有塔楼，另一座没有。

sentences.english: I’m getting used to managing without a car.
sentences.chinese: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。

detailed_translations.english: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 户外；在外面；没有或不显示某事物

name: wonderful
trans: adj. 极好的，精彩的，绝妙的；奇妙的；美妙；胜；神妙

sentences.english: It’s wonderful what doctors can do nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 如今医生的本领着实令人称奇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极好的，精彩的，绝妙的；奇妙的；美妙；胜；神妙
detailed_translations.english: making you admire someone or something very much

name: work
trans: n. 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
detailed_translations.english: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

name: workplace
trans: n. 工作场所；车间

sentences.english: ...the difficulties facing women in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

name: worker
trans: n. 工人；劳动者；职蚁

sentences.english: the workers’ revolution
sentences.chinese: 工人阶级革命

detailed_translations.english: the members of the  working class

name: worry
trans: n. 担心；烦恼；撕咬

sentences.english: He’s been a constant source of worry .
sentences.chinese: 他总是让人担心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being anxious about something
to be anxious or unhappy about someone or something, so that you think about them a lot

name: worried
trans: adj. 担心的

sentences.english: She gave me a worried look.
sentences.chinese: 她担心地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: His parents must be worried sick (= extremely worried ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的父母肯定担心死了。

detailed_translations.english: unhappy because you keep thinking about a problem, or about something bad that might happen

name: worth
trans: n. 价值；财产

sentences.english: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
sentences.chinese: 其中一幅画值5万英镑。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

detailed_translations.english: having a value in money, etc.
how good or useful something is or how important it is to people

name: young
trans: n. 年轻人；（动物的）崽，仔

sentences.english: a young child
sentences.chinese: 幼儿

sentences.english: He’s younger than me.
sentences.chinese: 他比我小。

sentences.english: You’re too young to get married.
sentences.chinese: 你还太小，不能结婚。

sentences.english: young trees
sentences.chinese: 小树

sentences.english: When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻时候想当模特。

sentences.english: John was a great footballer in his younger days(= when he was younger ).
sentences.chinese: 约翰年轻时是个很棒的足球运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
young people

name: above
trans: prep. 超过；在……上面；在……之上

sentences.english: He lived in a flat above the shop.
sentences.chinese: 他住在那商店上面的一套房间里。

sentences.english: The airliner flew above the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 大型客机在云层上面飞行。

sentences.english: The salaries we offer are well above (= much higher than ) average.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供的薪资远高于平均水平。

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: accept
trans: vi. 承认；同意；承兑

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: acceptable
trans: adj. 可接受的；合意的；可忍受的

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: accord
trans: n. 符合；一致；协议；自愿

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
detailed_translations.english: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

name: acquaintance
trans: n. 熟人；相识；了解；知道

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

name: active
trans: n. 主动语态；积极分子

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。
