detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: activity
trans: 活动

name: address
trans: n. 地址；演讲；致辞；说话的技巧；称呼

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: admire
trans: vt. 钦佩；赞美

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: admiration
trans: n. 钦佩；赞赏；羡慕；赞美

sentences.english: Daniel gazed at her in admiration .
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔用爱慕的眼神注视着她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great respect and liking for something or someone

name: admirable
trans: adj. 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的

sentences.english: an admirable achievement
sentences.chinese: 令人钦佩的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的
detailed_translations.english: having many good qualities that you respect and admire

name: admit
trans: vi. 承认；容许

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: advertise
trans: vt. 通知；为…做广告；使突出

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

name: advertiser
trans: n. 广告客户；刊登广告的人

sentences.english: the Stockport Advertiser
sentences.chinese: 《斯托克波特广告报》

detailed_translations.chinese: 广告客户；刊登广告的人
detailed_translations.english: a person or company that advertises something

name: advertisement
trans: n. 广告，宣传

sentences.english: They put an advertisement in ‘The Morning News’, offering a high salary for the right person.
sentences.chinese: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事，出高薪寻找合适的人选。

sentences.english: The organizers of the concert had taken out a full page advertisement in ‘The New York Times’.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
sentences.chinese: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

detailed_translations.english: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc

name: advise
trans: vt. 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: advice
trans: n. 建议；忠告；劝告；通知

sentences.english: You should have followed my advice.
sentences.chinese: 你真该听我的建议。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

name: advisable
trans: adj. 明智的，可取的，适当的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

name: adviser
trans: n. 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）

sentences.english: a financial adviser
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

detailed_translations.chinese: 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice because they know a lot about a subject, especially in business, law, or politics

name: affordable
trans: adj. 负担得起的

sentences.english: ...the availability of affordable housing.
sentences.chinese: …多数人支付得起的房产的供应。

detailed_translations.english: If something is affordable, most people have enough money to buy it

name: after
trans: conj. 在……之后

sentences.english: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
sentences.chinese: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。

sentences.english: I go swimming every day after work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天下班后都去游泳。

sentences.english: Do you believe in life after death?
sentences.chinese: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

sentences.english: The first attack started just after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。

sentences.english: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.
sentences.chinese: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。

sentences.english: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
sentences.chinese: 报警之后，你做了些什么？

sentences.english: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
sentences.chinese: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。

sentences.english: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

name: afterward
trans: adv. 以后，后来

sentences.english: Shortly afterward, police arrested four suspects.
sentences.chinese: 之后不久，警方逮捕了４名嫌疑犯。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something or if something happens afterward, you do it or it happens after a particular event or time that has already been mentioned

name: against
trans: prep. 反对，违反；靠；倚；防备

sentences.english: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。

sentences.english: sailing against the wind
sentences.chinese: 逆风航行

detailed_translations.english: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

name: age
trans: n. 年龄；时代；寿命，使用年限；阶段

sentences.english: Francis is the same age as me.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯和我同年岁。

sentences.english: Experts disagree over the age of the drawings.
sentences.chinese: 专家对这些画作的年代意见不统一。

sentences.english: Dad retired at the age of 56.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸是在56岁时退休的。

sentences.english: We are living in the age of technology.
sentences.chinese: 我们生活在科技时代。

sentences.english: He was worried to see how much she’d aged.
sentences.chinese: 看到她苍老了许多，他很担心。

detailed_translations.english: the number of years someone has lived or something has existed
to start looking older or to make someone or something look older

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: ago
trans: adj. 以前的；过去的

sentences.english: They moved to a new house some time ago (=  a fairly long time ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。

sentences.english: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
sentences.chinese: 不久前，我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

detailed_translations.english: used to show how far back in the past something happened

name: agree
trans: vi. vi. 同意，意见一致；约定，商定

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

name: agreement
trans: n. 协议；同意，一致

sentences.english: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.english: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

name: agricultural
trans: adj. 农业的；农艺的

sentences.english: Farmers struggling for survival strip the forests for agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 为生存而挣扎的农民们把森林伐光来作农业用地。

detailed_translations.english: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: aid
trans: n. 援助；帮助；助手；帮助者

sentences.english: He was breathing only with the aid of a ventilator.
sentences.chinese: 他只有靠呼吸器呼吸。

sentences.english: first aid
sentences.chinese: 急救；急救护理

detailed_translations.english: help that you need to do a particular thing

name: aim
trans: n. 目的；目标；对准

sentences.english: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛举枪瞄准，但是没有射击。

sentences.english: My criticism wasn't aimed at you.
sentences.chinese: 我的批评不是针对你的。

sentences.english: They are aiming to reduce unemployment by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 他们正力求使失业人数下降50%。

detailed_translations.english: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

name: alone
trans: adj. 独自的；单独的；孤独的

sentences.english: She lives alone.
sentences.chinese: 她一个人生活。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t leave a child alone in the house.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把小孩独自留在家里。

sentences.english: My wife and I like to spend time alone together away from the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我和妻子喜欢没有孩子打扰，过二人世界。

sentences.english: She has lived alone in this house for almost five years now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在已经独自在这所房子里住了差不多五年了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you
without any help from other people

name: also
trans: conj. 并且；另外

sentences.english: Information is also available on women’s health care.
sentences.chinese: 还可以获得有关女性保健方面的资料。

sentences.english: She sings beautifully and also plays the flute and piano.
sentences.chinese: 她歌唱得好，而且还会吹长笛和弹钢琴。

sentences.english: The system was not only complicated but also ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 这套系统不仅复杂而且效率低。

sentences.english: My girlfriend was also called Helen.
sentences.chinese: 我的女朋友也叫海伦。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to something else that you have mentioned

name: although
trans: conj. 尽管；虽然；但是；然而

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

name: always
trans: adv. 永远，一直；总是；常常

sentences.english: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.chinese: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.english: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.chinese: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.english: He hadn’t always been a butler.
sentences.chinese: 他并不是一直当管家。

sentences.english: I’ll always remember that day.
sentences.chinese: 我会永远记住那一天。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, at all times, or every time

name: amount
trans: n. 数量；总额，总数

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

name: amusement
trans: 可笑

name: amuse
trans: vt. 娱乐；消遣；使发笑；使愉快

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: ancient
trans: n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；述说；预示；播报

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: answer
trans: n. 回答；答案；答辩

sentences.english: Does this answer your requirements?
sentences.chinese: 这个符合你的要求吗？

detailed_translations.english: to be suitable for sth; to match sth

name: anxious
trans: adj. 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: anxiously
trans: adv. 不安地，忧虑地

sentences.english: Sometimes kids would come to the set, and I could see them looking at me anxiously.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，会有小孩来剧组参观，我可以看出他们不安地看著我。

name: any
trans: adj. 任何的；所有的；丝毫

sentences.english: Have you got any money?
sentences.chinese: 你身上有没有钱？

sentences.english: Any child who breaks the rules will be punished.
sentences.chinese: 凡违反规定的孩子都要受罚。

detailed_translations.english: some or even the smallest amount or number

name: anyone
trans: pron. 任何人；任何一个

sentences.english: Anyone could win tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚任何人都可能赢。

sentences.english: They offer help and advice to anyone interested in becoming a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他们为任何有兴趣当老师的人提供帮助和咨询。

sentences.english: If anyone sees Lisa, ask her to call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果有谁看见莉萨，叫她打电话给我。

sentences.english: Anyone else who is interested in going on the trip should see me at the end of this lesson.
sentences.chinese: 还有谁有兴趣参加此次旅行，下课来找我。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to any person, when it is not important to say exactly who

name: anything
trans: pron. 任何事

sentences.english: You can buy anything you want.
sentences.chinese: 你想要什么都可以买。

sentences.english: He was prepared to do anything to make a bit of money.
sentences.chinese: 只要能赚一点钱，他什么都愿意做。

sentences.english: Anything would be better than staying at home!
sentences.chinese: 做什么都比待在家里好！

sentences.english: You can write about swimming, skiing, or anything else you enjoy doing.
sentences.chinese: 你可以写游泳、写滑雪或者其他任何你喜欢的活动。

detailed_translations.english: any thing, event, situation etc, when it is not important to say exactly which

name: anywhere
trans: 在任何地方

name: appeal
trans: n. 呼吁，请求；吸引力，感染力；上诉；诉诸裁判

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: appear
trans: vi. 出现；显得；似乎；出庭；登场

sentences.english: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.english: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.english: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.chinese: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.english: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.chinese: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.english: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

name: appearance
trans: n. 外貌，外观；出现，露面

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: appreciate
trans: vi. 增值；涨价

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: appreciation
trans: n. 欣赏，鉴别；增值；感谢

sentences.english: He was presented with a watch in appreciation of his long service.
sentences.chinese: 他获赠一块手表，作为对其长期服务的感谢。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being grateful for something someone has done

name: around
trans: prep. 四处；在…周围

sentences.english: What an inspiration she was to all around her!
sentences.chinese: 她对于她周围所有的人是一种多么大的鼓舞!

sentences.english: All those around him looked at him with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人都对他投射出惊异的眼光。

name: arrive
trans: vi. 到达；成功；达成；出生

sentences.english: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
sentences.chinese: 打个电话给我，告诉我你已平安到达。

sentences.english: By the time the police arrived on the scene, the burglars had fled.
sentences.chinese: 警方赶到现场时，窃贼已经逃跑了。

sentences.english: When her wedding day arrived, she was really nervous.
sentences.chinese: 到了婚礼那天，她十分紧张。

detailed_translations.english: to get to the place you are going to

name: arrival
trans: n. 到来；到达；到达者

sentences.english: Only the timely arrival of the police prevented the situation from becoming worse.
sentences.chinese: 警方及时赶到才阻止了事态恶化。

sentences.english: Traffic problems account for one third of late arrivals.
sentences.chinese: 迟到的人有三分之一是因为交通问题。

sentences.english: The first arrivals at the concert got the best seats.
sentences.chinese: 最早来到音乐会的人坐上了最好的座位。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something arrives somewhere

name: as
trans: conj. 因为；随着；虽然；依照；当…时

sentences.english: I saw Peter as I was getting off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我下公共汽车的时候看见了彼得。

sentences.english: As time passed, things seemed to get worse.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，情况似乎变得更加糟糕了。

sentences.english: Just as the two men were leaving, a message arrived.
sentences.chinese: 那两个男子刚要离开，消息就传来了。

detailed_translations.english: while or when

name: ashamed
trans: adj. 惭愧的，感到难为情的；耻于……的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: aside
trans: prep. 在…旁边

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

name: ask
trans: vt. 问，询问；要求；需要；邀请；讨价

sentences.english: ‘What’s your name?’ she asked.
sentences.chinese: “你叫什么名字？”她问道 。

sentences.english: Don’t ask him – he won’t know.
sentences.chinese: 别问他，他不知道。

sentences.english: That kid’s always asking awkward questions.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子总是问一些尴尬的问题。

sentences.english: Let’s ask them to have dinner with us some time.
sentences.chinese: 哪天我们请他们一起吃晚餐。

sentences.english: You have no right to ask anything of me.
sentences.chinese: 你没有权利对我提任何要求。

sentences.english: Jerry’s too scared to ask her out.
sentences.chinese: 杰里没有勇气邀她出去。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or write to someone in order to get an answer, information, or a solution

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面；方向；形势；外貌

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: assistance
trans: 帮助

name: assist
trans: n. 帮助；助攻

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: assistant
trans: n. 助手，助理，助教

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: associate
trans: n. 同事，伙伴；关联的事物

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: at
trans: prep. 在（表示存在或出现的地点、场所、位置、空间）；以（某种价格、速度等）；向；达；因为；朝；忙于

sentences.english: They live at 18 Victoria Street.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在维多利亚街18 号。

sentences.english: Does this train stop at Preston?
sentences.chinese: 这列火车在普雷斯顿停吗？

sentences.english: I was waiting at the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 我在公共汽车站等着。

sentences.english: Liz and her friend sat down at a corner table.
sentences.chinese: 莉兹和她的朋友在靠角落的一张桌子旁坐下。

sentences.english: Turn left at the church.
sentences.chinese: 在教堂那里朝左转。

sentences.english: We’ll meet at Harry’s (=  at Harry’s house  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将在哈里家碰头。

sentences.english: I spent an unpleasant hour at the dentist’s.
sentences.chinese: 我在牙医诊所度过了难熬的一小时。

sentences.english: The film starts at 8 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 电影8点钟开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to say exactly where something or someone is, or where something happens

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: automatically
trans: adj. 不经思索的

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: automatic
trans: n. 自动机械；自动手枪

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: avoid
trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: awake
trans: adj. 醒着的

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: aware
trans: adj. 意识到的；知道的；有…方面知识的；懂世故的

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: awareness
trans: 知道

name: away
trans: adv. 离去，离开；在远处

sentences.english: Go away!
sentences.chinese: 走开！

sentences.english: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
sentences.chinese: 黛娜一边哭一边慢慢地开车走了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person

name: back
trans: n. 后面；背部；靠背；足球等的后卫；书报等的末尾

sentences.english: I’ll be back in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 我马上回来。

sentences.english: Put that book back where you found it!
sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

sentences.english: He was back home by half past eleven.
sentences.chinese: 他是11点半之前回家的。

sentences.english: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
sentences.chinese: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

sentences.english: Kirov stepped back a pace.
sentences.chinese: 基洛夫往后退了一步。

detailed_translations.english: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

name: background
trans: n. 背景；隐蔽的位置

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: bad
trans: n. 坏事；坏人

sentences.english: I have some bad news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有坏消息要告诉你。

sentences.english: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
sentences.chinese: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。

sentences.english: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好，飞机延误了好几个小时。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 坏习惯很难改。

sentences.english: a bad smell
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or likely to cause problems

name: badly
trans: adv. 非常，很；严重地，厉害地；恶劣地

sentences.english: The company has been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司的管理非常差。

sentences.english: He’s been limping badly ever since the skiing accident.
sentences.chinese: 出了那次滑雪事故以后，他的腿跛得很厉害。

sentences.english: We badly wanted to help, but there was nothing we could do.
sentences.chinese: 我们很想帮忙，可又无计可施。

sentences.english: He was beaten so badly that his brother didn’t recognize him.
sentences.chinese: 他被打得连他哥哥都认不出他了。

sentences.english: The school is badly in need of (=  very much needs  ) some new computers.
sentences.chinese: 学校急需一些新电脑。

sentences.english: Things started to go badly wrong (=  go wrong in a serious way  ) for Eric after he lost his job.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克失去工作以后，一切都很不如意。

detailed_translations.english: in an unsatisfactory or unsuccessful way

name: basic
trans: n. 基础；要素

sentences.english: the basic principles of chemistry
sentences.chinese: 化学的基本原理

sentences.english: The basic idea is simple.
sentences.chinese: 基本思想很简单。

sentences.english: basic research
sentences.chinese: 基础研究

sentences.english: basic information
sentences.chinese: 基本信息

detailed_translations.english: forming the most important or most necessary part of something

name: basis
trans: n. 基础；底部；主要成分；基本原则或原理

sentences.english: Their claim had no basis in fact (=  it was not true  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的说法没有事实根据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础， 根据； 原则
detailed_translations.english: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed

name: basically
trans: adv. 主要地，基本上

sentences.english: Basically, I’m just lazy.
sentences.chinese: 说穿了，我就是懒。

sentences.english: Well, basically, it’s a matter of filling in a few forms.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，其实也就是填几张表的事。

sentences.english: I used to see him every night, basically.
sentences.chinese: 基本上，我以前每天晚上都见他。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something, or a simple explanation of something

name: battle
trans: n. 战役；斗争

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: beat
trans: n. 拍子；敲击；有规律的一连串敲打

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

name: beautiful
trans: adj. 美丽的

sentences.english: She was even more beautiful than I had remembered.
sentences.chinese: 她比我记忆中更美。

sentences.english: a beautiful bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 一束美丽的花

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is beautiful is extremely attractive to look at

name: beauty
trans: n. 美；美丽；美人；美好的东西

sentences.english: her beauty and grace
sentences.chinese: 她的美貌和优雅风姿

sentences.english: an area of outstanding natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 一个自然风景极美的地区

sentences.english: Millions of dollars are spent each year on beauty products.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有上千万的钱花在美容产品上。

sentences.english: She was considered a great beauty in her youth.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻时被视为大美人。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that people, places, or things have that makes them very attractive to look at

name: before
trans: prep. 在…之前，先于

sentences.english: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。

sentences.english: Let’s meet at our house before the show.
sentences.chinese: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。

sentences.english: Larry arrived home before me.
sentences.chinese: 拉里在我之前到家。

sentences.english: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。

sentences.english: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.
sentences.chinese: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。

detailed_translations.english: earlier than something or someone

name: begin
trans: vi. 开始；首先

sentences.english: As everybody’s here, let’s begin.
sentences.chinese: 大家都到齐了，我们就开始吧。

sentences.english: In the third year students begin the study of classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 学生在三年级开始学古代汉语。

sentences.english: The president begins talks with the prime minister tonight.
sentences.chinese: 总统将于今晚和首相展开会谈。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something
to start doing something

name: beginning
trans: n. 开始；起点

sentences.english: There’s a short poem at the beginning of every chapter.
sentences.chinese: 每一章的开头都有一首短诗。

sentences.english: From the beginning of my career as a journalist, I’ve been writing about gender issues.
sentences.chinese: 从我一开始干记者这一行，我就写性别议题的题材。

sentences.english: I thought he loved me; perhaps he did in the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 我以为他爱我，也许开始时他确实是爱我的。

sentences.english: That chance meeting marked the beginning of a long and happy relationship.
sentences.chinese: 那次邂逅展开了一段长久而幸福的关系。

sentences.english: This is just the beginning of a new and different life for you.
sentences.chinese: 这只是你新的别样生活的开始。

sentences.english: I said he would cause trouble, right from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就说过，他会惹事。

sentences.english: I opposed it from the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就反对。

sentences.english: The whole trip was a disaster from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 旅途从头到尾都在出乱子。

sentences.english: I think I have the beginnings of a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉要感冒了。

sentences.english: He rose from humble beginnings to great wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他出身卑微，如今已腰缠万贯。

detailed_translations.english: the start or first part of an event, story, period of time etc

name: behind
trans: prep. 落后于；支持；晚于

sentences.english: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。

sentences.english: Someone could easily creep up behind us.
sentences.chinese: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。

sentences.english: The car behind was hooting impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。

sentences.english: Jane shut the door behind her.
sentences.chinese: 简随手关上身后的门。

sentences.english: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
sentences.chinese: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the back of a thing or person

name: believe
trans: vi. 信任；料想；笃信宗教

sentences.english: You shouldn’t believe everything you read.
sentences.chinese: 你不应尽信书上看来的东西。

sentences.english: I believed him, even though his story sounded unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 我相信了他，尽管他的话听上去难以置信。

sentences.english: I don’t believe a word of it (=  I think it is completely untrue  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我一句话也不相信。

sentences.english: Did you honestly believe that I’d be stupid enough to do that?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为我会傻到做那样的事情吗？。

detailed_translations.english: to be sure that something is true or that someone is telling the truth

name: belief
trans: n. 相信，信赖；信仰；教义

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

name: below
trans: prep. 在…下面

sentences.english: an animal that lives below ground
sentences.chinese: 生活在地下的动物

sentences.english: Water was dripping onto the floor below.
sentences.chinese: 水滴到下面的地板上。

sentences.english: I could hear voices in the courtyard below my window.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到院子里有人在我的窗下说话。

sentences.english: They camped a few hundred feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 他们在山峰下面几百英尺的地方扎了营。

sentences.english: Down below, people were talking and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 下面，人们谈笑风生。

sentences.english: Somewhere far below, a door slammed.
sentences.chinese: 下面远远的什么地方有一扇门砰地关上了。

sentences.english: The kitchen is directly below her bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 厨房就在她卧室的正下方。

sentences.english: Captain Parker went below (=  to the lower level of the ship  ) , leaving Clooney in charge.
sentences.chinese: 帕克船长下去了，让克卢尼掌舵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在下面，在较低处；在本页下面
detailed_translations.english: in a lower place or position, or on a lower level

name: beside
trans: prep. 在旁边；与…相比；和…无关

sentences.english: Wendy came up and sat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed
sentences.chinese: 床边的桌子

sentences.english: I was standing right beside her at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

name: beyond
trans: prep. 超过；越过；那一边；在...较远的一边

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

name: biological
trans: adj. 生物的；生物学的

sentences.english: the biological functions of the body
sentences.chinese: 人体的生物机能

sentences.english: Depression is both biological and psychological.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

name: biology
trans: n. （一个地区全部的）生物；生物学

sentences.english: a degree in biology
sentences.chinese: 生物学学位

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of living things

name: bit
trans: n. [计] 比特（二进位制信息单位）；少量；马嚼子；辅币；老一套；一点，一块

sentences.english: He’s taken the engine to bits .
sentences.chinese: 他把发动机拆开了。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something

name: blessed
trans: v. 祝福（bless的过去分词）

sentences.english: the Blessed Virgin
sentences.chinese: 圣母马利亚

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸福的；受祝福的；神圣的
detailed_translations.english: holy

name: bless
trans: vt. 祝福；保佑；赞美

sentences.english: He’s always willing to help. Bless him!
sentences.chinese: 他一向乐于助人，愿上帝保佑他！

sentences.english: ‘Jess made this card for me.’ ‘Bless!’
sentences.chinese: “杰斯给我做了这张卡。”“真不错！”

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are fond of someone, amused by them, or pleased by something they have done

name: blood
trans: n. 血，血液；血统

sentences.english: Her body was found in a pool of blood.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现倒在血泊之中。

sentences.english: Blood oozed from a cut on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 血从他额头的伤口里渗了出来。

sentences.english: There’s Irish blood on his mother’s side.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲有爱尔兰血统。

detailed_translations.english: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body

name: blow
trans: n. 吹；打击；殴打

sentences.english: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.english: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.english: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.chinese: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

name: boast
trans: n. 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: bold
trans: adj. 大胆的，英勇的；黑体的；厚颜无耻的；险峻的

sentences.english: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.english: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

name: boldness
trans: n. 大胆；冒失；显著

name: boldly
trans: adv. 大胆地；冒失地；显眼地

name: bonding
trans: n. 粘合；[机][电子] 压焊

name: boost
trans: n. 推动；帮助；宣扬

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: boring
trans: n. 钻孔

sentences.english: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。

sentences.english: The job was dull and boring.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的
detailed_translations.english: not interesting in any way

name: bored
trans: v. 使厌烦（bore的过去式）；烦扰

sentences.english: He was easily bored.
sentences.chinese: 他很容易感到厌烦。

sentences.english: After a while, I got bored and left.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我觉得无聊，就走了。

detailed_translations.english: tired and impatient because you do not think something is interesting, or because you have nothing to do

name: borrow
trans: vt. 借；借用

sentences.english: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借你的笔用一下吗？

sentences.english: They borrowed heavily (=  borrowed a lot of money  ) from the bank to start their new business.
sentences.chinese: 他们向银行贷了巨款来创办新公司。

detailed_translations.english: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later

name: boss
trans: n. 老板；首领；工头

sentences.english: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
sentences.chinese: 我得向老板请一天假。

sentences.english: Since I’m my own boss (=  I work for myself, rather than for an employer  ) , my hours are flexible.
sentences.chinese: 我自己当老板，所以我的时间很灵活。

sentences.english: Five-year-old girls love to boss people around.
sentences.chinese: 五岁的女孩就爱支使别人。

detailed_translations.english: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it

name: break
trans: vi. 打破；折断；弄坏；削弱

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: breakup
trans: n. 解体；分裂；崩溃；馏分组成；停止

sentences.english: the breakup of her marriage
sentences.chinese: 她婚姻的破裂

detailed_translations.english: the act of ending a marriage or relationship

name: boundary
trans: n. 边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: bound
trans: n. 范围；跳跃

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: breath
trans: n. 呼吸，气息；一口气，（呼吸的）一次；瞬间，瞬息；微风；迹象；无声音，气音

sentences.english: Slow down, I need to catch my breath.
sentences.chinese: 慢一点，我要喘口气。

detailed_translations.english: the air that you take into your lungs and send out again

name: breathe
trans: vi. 呼吸；低语；松口气；（风）轻拂

sentences.english: The room filled with smoke, and it was becoming difficult to breathe.
sentences.chinese: 房间里全是烟，呼吸越来越困难。

sentences.english: People are concerned about the quality of the air they breathe.
sentences.chinese: 人们关心他们所呼吸的空气的质量。

sentences.english: Relax and breathe deeply (=  take in a lot of air  ) .
sentences.chinese: 放松，深呼吸。

detailed_translations.english: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
to take air into your lungs and send it out again

name: brotherly
trans: adj. 兄弟的；兄弟般的；亲切的

sentences.english: brotherly love
sentences.chinese: 兄弟之爱

sentences.english: brotherly advice
sentences.chinese: 兄长般的劝告

detailed_translations.chinese: 兄弟的；兄弟般的；亲切的
detailed_translations.english: showing feelings of kindness, loyalty etc that you would expect a brother to show

name: brown
trans: n. 褐色，棕色

sentences.english: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
sentences.chinese: 这个型号的产品有棕色、白色和灰色的。

sentences.english: the browns and greens of the landscape
sentences.chinese: 棕绿相映的风景

detailed_translations.english: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

name: bundle
trans: n. 束；捆

sentences.english: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
sentences.chinese: 一个小包袱，里面主要是衣服

sentences.english: He was bundled into a car and driven 50 miles to a police station.
sentences.chinese: 他被塞进一辆小汽车，被带到50英里外的警察局。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things such as papers, clothes, or sticks that are fastened or tied together

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集， 归拢； 把…塞入
detailed_translations.english: If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way

name: burden
trans: n. 负担；责任；船的载货量

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

name: burn
trans: n. 灼伤，烧伤；烙印

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: call
trans: n. 电话；呼叫；要求；访问

sentences.english: You may call it harmless fun, but I call it pornography.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会说这是无恶意的小玩笑，但是我却认为这是色情。

sentences.english: I heard someone calling in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我听到远处有人在叫。

detailed_translations.english: to use a word or name to describe someone or something in a particular way

name: calm
trans: 平静的

name: can
trans: aux. 能； 能够； 可以； 可能

sentences.english: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced, or otherwise processed.
sentences.chinese: …将要经过装罐、去皮、切块或其他加工程序的水果和蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

name: capacity
trans: n. 能力；容量；资格，地位；生产力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: career
trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: carry
trans: n. 运载；[计] 进位；射程

sentences.english: The morning paper carried a story about demonstrations in New York and Washington D.C.
sentences.chinese: 晨报登载了纽约和华盛顿特区举行示威游行的报道。

sentences.english: The national TV network carries religious programmes.
sentences.chinese: 全国电视网播出宗教节目。

detailed_translations.english: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it

name: case
trans: n. 情况；实例；箱

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

name: century
trans: n. 世纪，百年；（板球）一百分

sentences.english: the story of life on a small farm at the turn of the century
sentences.chinese: 讲述世纪初一个小农场生活的故事

detailed_translations.english: one of the 100-year periods measured from before or after the year of Christ’s birth

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: chance
trans: n. 机会，际遇；运气，侥幸；可能性

sentences.english: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.english: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.english: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.english: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.chinese: 她生还的可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

name: change
trans: n. 变化；找回的零钱

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

name: channel
trans: n. 通道；频道；海峡

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: character
trans: n. 性格，品质；特性；角色；[计] 字符

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: charge
trans: n. 费用；电荷；掌管；控告；命令；负载

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: cheat
trans: n. 欺骗，作弊；骗子

sentences.english: The company engaged in a deliberate effort to cheat them out of their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司曾蓄意诈取他们的养老金。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cheats you out of something, they get it from you by behaving dishonestly
to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

name: cheater
trans: n. 骗子；背叛者；眼镜

detailed_translations.chinese: 骗子, 欺诈者, 背叛者
detailed_translations.english: A cheater is someone who cheats

name: check
trans: n. <美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: checkout
trans: n. 检验；签出；结账台；检出

name: chief
trans: n. 首领；酋长；主要部分

sentences.english: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.english: Safety is our chief concern .
sentences.chinese: 安全问题是我们的头等大事。

sentences.english: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为人们更长寿了。

sentences.english: his chief rival for the job
sentences.chinese: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.english: the prosecution’s chief witness
sentences.chinese: 控方的主要证人

sentences.english: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
sentences.chinese: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 首领， 长官； 酋长， 族长
detailed_translations.english: the ruler of a tribe

name: chiefly
trans: adv. 主要地；首先

sentences.english: The work consists chiefly of interviewing the public.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是采访公众。

sentences.english: I lived abroad for years, chiefly in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我在国外生活了很多年，主要在意大利。

detailed_translations.english: mostly but not completely

name: child
trans: n. 儿童，小孩，孩子；产物；子孙；幼稚的人；弟子

sentences.english: The hotel is ideal for families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆对带小孩的家庭再合适不过。

sentences.english: The film is not suitable for children under 12.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片不适合12岁以下的儿童观看。

sentences.english: I was very happy as a child (= when I was a child ) .
sentences.chinese: 我小时候很幸福。

sentences.english: a famous writer of children’s books
sentences.chinese: 著名的儿童文学作家

sentences.english: child victims of war
sentences.chinese: 战争受难儿童

sentences.english: I have five children, all happily married.
sentences.chinese: 我有五个孩子，他们的婚姻都很幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not yet an adult

name: children
trans: n. 孩子们（child的复数）

name: childhood
trans: n. 童年时期；幼年时代

sentences.english: I had a very happy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 我的童年很快乐。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time when you are a child

name: choice
trans: n. 选择；选择权；精选品

sentences.english: I think London was a good choice as a venue.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得伦敦是个很好的选址。

sentences.english: choice steak
sentences.chinese: 上等牛排

detailed_translations.english: the person or thing that someone chooses
(especially of food) of very good quality

name: choose
trans: vt. 选择，决定

sentences.english: It took us ages to choose a new carpet.
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选新地毯花了很长时间。

sentences.english: A panel of judges will choose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 会由一个评判小组选出冠军。

sentences.english: He chose his words carefully as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时字斟句酌。

sentences.english: You can, if you choose, invest in the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以投资股票市场。

detailed_translations.english: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

name: circle
trans: n. 循环，周期；圆；圈子；圆形物

sentences.english: Draw a circle 10cm in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径10厘米的圆形。

sentences.english: Johnson was part of the President’s inner circle (= the people who have the most influence ) .
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊是总统核心集团的人。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, fashion comes full circle.
sentences.chinese: 时尚迟早会流行回来的。

sentences.english: This is the road that circles the city.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那条环城路。

detailed_translations.english: a completely round shape, like the letter O
to move in the shape of a circle around something, especially in the air

name: circularly
trans: 循环地

name: citizen
trans: n. 公民；市民；老百姓

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

name: citizenship
trans: n. [法] 公民身份，公民资格；国籍；公民权

sentences.english: McGuirk holds dual citizenship (= the legal right of being a citizen in two countries ) in Ireland and the US.
sentences.chinese: 麦吉尔克拥有爱尔兰和美国的双重国籍。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 公民身份，公民资格；国籍；公民权
detailed_translations.english: the legal right of belonging to a particular country

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: claim
trans: n. 要求；声称；索赔；断言；值得

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: classical
trans: n. 古典音乐

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: climb
trans: n. 爬；攀登

sentences.english: Harry climbed the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 哈里爬上楼梯。

sentences.english: Boys were climbing trees along the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在河边爬树。

detailed_translations.english: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do
to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do

name: clue
trans: n. 线索；（故事等的）情节

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: colleague
trans: n. 同事，同僚

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: collect
trans: vt. 收集；募捐

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: collection
trans: n. 采集，聚集；[税收] 征收；收藏品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: color
trans: n. 颜色；肤色；颜料；脸色

sentences.english: What color dress did you buy?
sentences.chinese: 你买的连衣裙是什么颜色的？

sentences.english: jams that contain no artificial colors or preservatives
sentences.chinese: 不含人工色素和防腐剂的果酱

detailed_translations.english: red, blue, yellow, green, brown, purple etc

name: colorful
trans: adj. 华美的；有趣的；富有色彩的

sentences.english: I hope my life to be colorful and valuable.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的生活是丰富多彩的和有价值的。

sentences.english: And he often finds his life so colorful and interesting as he overcomes all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他经常觉得他的生活是丰富多彩和有趣的，因为他克服了所有的困难。

sentences.english: Because of her hard working, her garden was so colorful.
sentences.chinese: 因为她的努力，她的花园是如此的丰富多彩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有色彩的； 有趣的

name: come
trans: vi. 来；开始；出现；发生；变成；到达

sentences.english: Let me know when they come.
sentences.chinese: 他们来了就告诉我。

sentences.english: Can you come here for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 你到这里来一会儿好吗？

sentences.english: Come a bit closer and you’ll be able to see better.
sentences.chinese: 靠近一些就能看得更清楚。

sentences.english: What time will you be coming home ?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候能回家？

detailed_translations.english: to move towards you or arrive at the place where you are

name: comforting
trans: v. 安慰（comfort的ing形式）

name: comic
trans: n. 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物

sentences.english: a comic novel
sentences.chinese: 滑稽小说

detailed_translations.english: amusing you and making you want to laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
detailed_translations.english: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

name: comical
trans: adj. 滑稽的，好笑的

sentences.english: The note of pure panic in his voice was almost comical.
sentences.chinese: 他那种十分慌张的口气几乎有点滑稽。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or situations that are comical are funny in a strange or unexpected way

name: command
trans: n. 指挥，控制；命令；司令部

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: commander
trans: n. 指挥官；司令官

sentences.english: the American Commander, General Otis
sentences.chinese: 美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.english: our platoon commander
sentences.chinese: 我们的排长

detailed_translations.english: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

name: commit
trans: vt. 犯罪，做错事；把...交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

name: commitment
trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: common
trans: n. 普通；平民；公有地

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: commonly
trans: adv. 一般地；通常地；普通地

sentences.english: Sodium chloride is more commonly known as salt.
sentences.chinese: 氯化钠通常都称为盐。

sentences.english: a commonly used industrial chemical
sentences.chinese: 一种常用的工业化学品

detailed_translations.english: usually or by most people

name: community
trans: n. 社区；[生态] 群落；共同体；团体

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: comparatively
trans: adv. 比较地；相当地

sentences.english: a comparatively small number of people
sentences.chinese: 相对较少的人数

sentences.english: Comparatively few books have been written on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 有关这方面的书相对较少。

sentences.english: Crime on the island is comparatively rare .
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上犯罪活动相对较少。

sentences.english: Comparatively speaking, this part of the coast is still unspoiled.
sentences.chinese: 相对而言，这一段海岸尚未遭到破坏。

detailed_translations.english: as compared to something else or to a previous state

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: complain
trans: vi. 投诉；发牢骚；诉说

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨；诉苦；疾病；委屈

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: completely
trans: adv. 完全地，彻底地；完整地

sentences.english: I completely forgot that it’s his birthday today.
sentences.chinese: 我完全忘了今天是他的生日。

sentences.english: He had never completely recovered from his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他病后一直没有完全康复。

sentences.english: a completely new range of low-cost computers
sentences.chinese: 全新的低价电脑系列

sentences.english: I’m not completely sure.
sentences.chinese: 我不能十分肯定。

sentences.english: Portuguese is pronounced completely differently from Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙语的发音和西班牙语的完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: to the greatest degree possible

name: complete
trans: adj. 完整的；完全的；彻底的

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: concentrate
trans: 集中

name: concentration
trans: n. 浓度；集中；浓缩；专心；集合

sentences.english: She needed all her powers of concentration to stop herself from slipping on the icy road.
sentences.chinese: 她需要集中全部注意力才能不让自己在结冰的路上滑倒。

sentences.english: Lack of concentration was a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 注意力不集中是个大问题。

sentences.english: I lost my concentration and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我精神一放松就睡着了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中； 专注， 专心； 浓缩； 浓度
detailed_translations.english: the ability to think about something carefully or for a long time

name: concept
trans: n. 观念，概念

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: conclusion
trans: n. 结论；结局；推论

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: conclude
trans: vi. 推断；断定；决定

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: confident
trans: adj. 自信的；确信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: confidence
trans: n. 信心；信任；秘密

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: conscious
trans: adj. 意识到的；故意的；神志清醒的

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: consciously
trans: adv. 自觉地；有意识地

sentences.english: They do not consciously think of themselves as a class.
sentences.chinese: 他们并不有意识地把自己当作一个阶层来看待。

name: construction
trans: n. 建设；建筑物；解释；造句

sentences.english: a road construction project
sentences.chinese: 道路修建计划

sentences.english: construction workers
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人

detailed_translations.english: the process of building things such as houses, bridges, roads etc

name: constructive
trans: adj. 建设性的；推定的；构造上的；有助益的

sentences.english: The meeting was very constructive.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议很有建设性。

sentences.english: We welcome any constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们欢迎任何有建设性的批评。

detailed_translations.english: useful and helpful, or likely to produce good results

name: construct
trans: n. 构想，概念

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: continent
trans: n. 大陆，洲，陆地

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

name: contrary
trans: n. 相反；反面

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: contribution
trans: n. 贡献；捐献；投稿

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: contribute
trans: vt. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: control
trans: n. 控制；管理；抑制；操纵装置

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

name: cook
trans: 烹调

name: cooker
trans: 炊具

name: cool
trans: n. 凉爽；凉爽的空气

sentences.english: She swam out into the cool water.
sentences.chinese: 她往外游向清凉的水里。

sentences.english: The evening air was cool.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚的空气很凉爽。

sentences.english: Relax in the sun with a cool drink.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光下喝杯清凉饮料放松一下。

sentences.english: the cooler weather of September
sentences.chinese: 九月较凉爽的天气

detailed_translations.english: low in temperature, but not cold, often in a way that feels pleasant
to make something slightly colder, or to become slightly colder
