detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: next
trans: adv. 然后；下次；其次

sentences.english: The next six months will be the hardest.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的六个月将是最难熬的。

sentences.english: The man in the next chair was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 邻座的男子睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: coming straight after sb/sth in time, order or space

name: noisy
trans: adj. .嘈杂的；喧闹的；聒噪的

sentences.english: The kids have been really noisy today.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们今天实在是吵。

sentences.english: a noisy engine
sentences.chinese: 噪声大的发动机

sentences.english: The bar was very noisy.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧里非常嘈杂。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise

name: noise
trans: n. [环境] 噪音；响声；杂音

sentences.english: What’s that noise?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么声音？

sentences.english: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

sentences.english: There was a lot of noise outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面很吵闹。

sentences.english: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
sentences.chinese: 噪音水平下降了20%。

detailed_translations.english: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

name: norm
trans: n. 标准，规范

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: north
trans: n. 北，北方

sentences.english: Which way is north?
sentences.chinese: 哪边是北？

sentences.english: He lives in North Wales.
sentences.chinese: 他住在威尔士北部。

detailed_translations.english: the direction that is at the top of a map of the world, above the Equator. It is on the left if you are facing the rising sun
in the north or facing the north

name: Northen
trans: 诺森

name: not
trans: adv. 表示否定，不

sentences.english: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
sentences.chinese: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。

sentences.english: She’s not a very nice person.
sentences.chinese: 她为人不太好。

sentences.english: You were wrong not to inform the police.
sentences.chinese: 你没有通知警方是错误的。

sentences.english: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
sentences.chinese: “我们能去公园吗？”“不，今天不行，亲爱的。”

detailed_translations.english: used to make a word, statement, or question negative

name: nothing
trans: 没有什么

name: now
trans: adv. 现在；如今；立刻

sentences.english: She's a widow now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在是一个寡妇。

sentences.english: But we are now a much more fragmented society.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们现在是一个更加四分五裂的社会。

sentences.english: If we leave now we’ll be there before dark.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们现在出发，天黑之前就能赶到那里。

detailed_translations.english: (at) the present time

name: nowhere
trans: adv. 无处；任何地方都不；毫无结果

sentences.english: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

detailed_translations.english: not in any place or to any place

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: objective
trans: adj. 客观的；目标的；宾格的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: obviously
trans: adv. 明显地

sentences.english: We’re obviously going to need more help.
sentences.chinese: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。

sentences.english: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，这要花点时间。

sentences.english: Cost is obviously important.
sentences.chinese: 费用当然很重要。

sentences.english: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 她皱起眉头，显然感到不解。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

name: obvious
trans: 明显的

name: of
trans: prep. 关于；属于；…的；由…组成的

sentences.english: the back of the house
sentences.chinese: 房子的后部

sentences.english: the last scene of the movie
sentences.chinese: 电影的最后一个场景

sentences.english: the end of the day
sentences.chinese: 一天的末了

sentences.english: to be proud of sth
sentences.chinese: 为某事自豪

detailed_translations.english: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from

name: off
trans: prep. 离开；脱落

sentences.english: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.chinese: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.english: Will someone switch the radio off?
sentences.chinese: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？

detailed_translations.english: away from a place

name: offer
trans: 提供

name: official
trans: adj. 官方的；正式的；公务的

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: often
trans: adv. 常常，时常

sentences.english: She often works at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她周末经常要上班。

sentences.english: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.english: How often do you see your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你隔多久去看你父母？

sentences.english: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.chinese: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

name: on
trans: adv. 向前地；作用中，行动中；继续着

sentences.english: I wanted to punch him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。

sentences.english: Matt kissed her on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched

name: only
trans: adv. 只，仅仅；不料

sentences.english: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
sentences.chinese: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。

sentences.english: There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.english: It’s only eight o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 才8点钟。

sentences.english: I was the only woman there.
sentences.chinese: 我是那里唯一的女性。

detailed_translations.english: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

name: open
trans: adj. 公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

name: operate
trans: vi. 运转；动手术；起作用

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: operation
trans: n. 操作；经营；[外科] 手术；[数][计] 运算

sentences.english: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

detailed_translations.english: an action done by a computer

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: optimism
trans: n. 乐观；乐观主义

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: optional
trans: adj. 可选择的，随意的

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

name: option
trans: n. [计] 选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: or
trans: conj. 或，或者；还是

sentences.english: Shall we go out to the cinema or stay at home?
sentences.chinese: 我们是出去看电影还是待在家里？

sentences.english: You can have ham, cheese, or tuna.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择火腿、干酪或者金枪鱼。

sentences.english: She wasn’t involved in drugs or anything like that.
sentences.chinese: 她没有涉毒之类的行为。

sentences.english: Grapes are usually either green or red.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄一般要么是绿色，要么是红色。

sentences.english: He’s going to do it whether we like it or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管我们喜欢与否，他都会去做这件事。

sentences.english: It’s going to snow tomorrow, or that’s what the forecast says.
sentences.chinese: 明天要下雪，确切地说，气象预报是这样说的。

detailed_translations.english: used between two words or phrases to show that either of two things is possible, or used before the last in a list of possibilities or choices

name: organic
trans: adj. [有化] 有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: organize
trans: vt. 组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: organization
trans: n. 组织；机构；体制；团体

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

name: otherwise
trans: adv. 否则；另外；在其他方面

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: out
trans: adv. 出现；在外；出局；出声地；不流行地

sentences.english: She opened her suitcase and took out a pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 她打开手提箱，拿出一双鞋。

sentences.english: Lock the door on your way out.
sentences.chinese: 你出去时把门锁上。

sentences.english: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.
sentences.chinese: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。

sentences.english: Out you go (= used to order someone to leave a room )!
sentences.chinese: 你给我出去！

sentences.english: When the sun came out, a rainbow formed in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 太阳出来时，天空中出现了一道彩虹。

detailed_translations.english: from inside an object, container, building, or place

name: outdoors
trans: adv. 在户外

sentences.english: It’s warm enough to eat outdoors tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚很暖和，可以在户外用餐。

sentences.english: He likes to work outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢在户外工作。

detailed_translations.english: outside, not in a building
the countryside far away from buildings and cities

name: outlook
trans: n. 展望；观点；景色

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: outstanding
trans: adj. 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: overcome
trans: vt. 克服；胜过

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: overhear
trans: vt. 无意中听到；偷听

sentences.english: I overheard part of their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我碰巧听到了他们谈话的部分内容。

sentences.english: I couldn’t help overhearing your argument.
sentences.chinese: 我无意中听到了你们的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to accidentally hear what other people are saying, when they do not know that you have heard

name: overlook
trans: vt. 忽略；俯瞰；远眺；检查；高耸于…之上

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: overnight
trans: adv. 通宵；突然；昨晚

sentences.english: He became a millionaire overnight.
sentences.chinese: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

detailed_translations.english: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
happening during the night or for the night

name: owner
trans: n. [经] 所有者；物主

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: pack
trans: n. 包装；一群；背包；包裹；一副

sentences.english: I forgot to pack my razor.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people packed into the mosque.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千的人挤进了清真寺。

sentences.english: Send away for your free information pack today.
sentences.chinese: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

detailed_translations.english: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

name: paint
trans: vt. 油漆；绘画；装饰；涂色于；描绘；（用语言，文字等）描写；擦脂粉等

sentences.english: The ceiling needs painting.
sentences.chinese: 天花板需要粉刷了。

sentences.english: brightly paintedhouses
sentences.chinese: 粉刷得很亮丽的房屋

sentences.english: The living room was painted in pastel shades of pink and blue.
sentences.chinese: 起居室被漆成淡雅的粉色和蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to put paint on a surface
to make a picture, design etc using paint

name: painter
trans: n. 画家；油漆匠

sentences.english: Gerry’s ambition was to become a portrait painter.
sentences.chinese: 格里的志向是成为一名肖像画家。

sentences.english: painter and decorator
sentences.chinese: 油漆装修工

detailed_translations.english: someone who paints pictures

name: panic
trans: n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: participate
trans: vi. 参与，参加；分享

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: participation
trans: 参加

name: particular
trans: n. 详细说明；个别项目

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: particularly
trans: adv. 特别地，独特地；详细地，具体地；明确地，细致地

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

name: partly
trans: adv. 部分地；在一定程度上

sentences.english: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。

sentences.english: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。

sentences.english: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
sentences.chinese: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作，部分原因是母亲病了。

sentences.english: The group is funded partly by the government.
sentences.chinese: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

detailed_translations.english: to some degree, but not completely

name: pass
trans: n. 及格；经过；护照；途径；传球

sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

name: passenger
trans: n. 旅客；乘客；过路人；碍手碍脚的人

sentences.english: Neither the driver nor the passengers were hurt.
sentences.chinese: 司机和乘客均未受伤。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it

name: paste
trans: n. 面团，膏；糊状物，[胶粘] 浆糊

sentences.english: Data can be pasted into word processing documents.
sentences.chinese: 数据可以粘贴到文字处理文件中。

detailed_translations.english: to make words that you have removed or copied appear in a new place on a computer screen

detailed_translations.chinese: 面团，膏；糊状物，[胶粘] 浆糊
detailed_translations.english: a soft thick mixture that can easily be shaped or spread

name: peace
trans: n. 和平；平静；和睦；秩序

sentences.english: The country is at peace with its neighbours for the first time in years.
sentences.chinese: 这是多年来该国与其邻国第一次和平共处。

sentences.english: By the end of the century, France had made peace with Britain.
sentences.chinese: 到那个世纪末，法国和英国议和了。

sentences.english: a city where people of different religions have lived together in peace for centuries
sentences.chinese: 不同宗教的人们和平共处数百年的城市

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 为该地区争取和平的努力

sentences.english: a dangerous situation which threatens world peace
sentences.chinese: 威胁世界和平的危险状况

sentences.english: An uneasy peace continued until 1939.
sentences.chinese: 不稳定的和平局面维持到1939年。

sentences.english: the Northern Ireland peace talks
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰和平会谈

sentences.english: an international peace conference
sentences.chinese: 国际和平大会

sentences.english: the peace treaty that ended the First World War
sentences.chinese: 终结第一次世界大战的和平条约

sentences.english: the Middle East peace process
sentences.chinese: 中东和平进程

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is no war or fighting

name: peaceful
trans: adj. 和平的，爱好和平的；平静的

sentences.english: We had a peaceful afternoon without the children.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们不在，我们度过了一个宁静的下午。

sentences.english: It’s very peaceful out here in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 这树林里真安静。

sentences.english: the use of nuclear power for peaceful purposes
sentences.chinese: 核能的和平利用

detailed_translations.english: a peaceful time, place, or situation is quiet and calm without any worry or excitement

name: peer
trans: vt. 封为贵族；与…同等

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: per
trans: prep. 每；经；按照；每一

sentences.english: How much does it cost per kilo?
sentences.chinese: 每公斤多少钱？

sentences.english: rooms costing £40 per night
sentences.chinese: 每晚收费40英镑的房间

sentences.english: Admission is £9.95 per adult.
sentences.chinese: 成人门票每位9.95英镑。

sentences.english: My car does 12 miles per litre (= for each litre of petrol ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的汽车每升汽油跑12英里。

sentences.english: The meal cost $25 per head (= for or by each person ) .
sentences.chinese: 那顿饭人均花费25美元。

detailed_translations.english: for each

name: percent
trans: n. 百分比，百分率；部分；百分数

sentences.english: At the end of the day, add up the percent DVs.
sentences.chinese: 在一天结束后，把所有营养素的百分比加起来。

sentences.english: Machines are delivering up to only 25 percent of the fuel they combust.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转效率只能达到所耗燃料的百分之二十五。

sentences.english: But there are billions more people out there who are not in the top one percent, and they’re not in the top two or three either.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有十亿多的人不在其中，他们不在其中的百分之一，也不再其中的两百分之一或者三百分之一的其中。

name: perfect
trans: n. 完成式

sentences.english: His English was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: perhaps
trans: n. 假定；猜想；未定之事

sentences.english: Perhaps she’s next door.
sentences.chinese: 她也许在隔壁。

sentences.english: Perhaps it will snow tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能会下雪。

sentences.english: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 也许下次不用那么久。

sentences.english: ‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not .’
sentences.chinese: “我想你不明白。”“嗯，也许吧。”

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure

name: period
trans: n. 周期，期间；时期；月经；课时；（语法学）句点，句号

sentences.english: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
sentences.chinese: 明天天气干燥，间或晴朗。

sentences.english: a double period of Science
sentences.chinese: 一连两节的自然科学课

sentences.english: Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注意标点，特别是逗号和句号的正确使用方法。

detailed_translations.english: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: pick
trans: n. 选择；鹤嘴锄；挖；掩护

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: plan
trans: n. 计划；平面图

sentences.english: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他计划先取得经济学学位，然后去国外工作一年。

sentences.english: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
sentences.chinese: 你周末有什么打算？

sentences.english: He immediately began planning his escape.
sentences.chinese: 他立即开始计划逃跑。

sentences.english: The former president is planning a return to politics.
sentences.chinese: 前总统打算重返政坛。

detailed_translations.english: something you have decided to do
to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: plastic
trans: n. 塑料制品；整形；可塑体

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

name: poor
trans: adj. 贫穷的；可怜的；贫乏的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: Her family were so poor they couldn’t afford to buy her new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她家穷得甚至买不起新衣服给她。

sentences.english: an area where poor people lived
sentences.chinese: 穷人居住区

sentences.english: one of the poorest countries in the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上最贫穷的国家之一

sentences.english: a poor part of Chicago (= where a lot of poor people live )
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥的一个贫民区

sentences.english: My grandparents grew up dirt poor (= very poor ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母在赤贫的环境里长大。

sentences.english: The country is poor in natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 该国自然资源匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: having very little money and not many possessions

name: population
trans: n. 人口；[生物] 种群，[生物] 群体；全体居民

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: pose
trans: vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: possession
trans: n. 拥有；财产；领地；自制；着迷

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

name: possess
trans: vt. 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: post
trans: n. 岗位；邮件；标杆

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

name: practical
trans: adj. 实际的；实用性的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: practically
trans: adv. 实际地；几乎；事实上

sentences.english: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.english: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.english: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.english: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.chinese: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: practice
trans: n. 实践；练习；惯例

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: predictor
trans: n. [气象] 预报器；预言者

name: prefer
trans: vt. 更喜欢；宁愿；提出；提升

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preferred
trans: v. 偏爱（prefer的过去分词）

name: prepare
trans: vt. 准备；使适合；装备；起草

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: preparation
trans: n. 预备；准备

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫，[物] 压强

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: press
trans: n. 压；按；新闻；出版社；[印刷] 印刷机

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: pretend
trans: vt. 假装，伪装，模拟

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: pretty
trans: n. 有吸引力的事物（尤指饰品）；漂亮的人

sentences.english: a pretty little girl
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小姑娘

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

name: prevent
trans: vt. 预防，防止；阻止

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: price
trans: n. 价格；价值；代价

sentences.english: The price of fuel keeps going up.
sentences.chinese: 燃料价格持续上涨。

sentences.english: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.chinese: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money you have to pay for something

name: pride
trans: n. 自豪；骄傲；自尊心

sentences.english: He wore his medals with pride.
sentences.chinese: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

sentences.english: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.chinese: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.english: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.chinese: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.english: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
sentences.chinese: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: primary
trans: n. 原色；最主要者

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: private
trans: n. 列兵；二等兵

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: prize
trans: n. 奖品；奖赏；战利品

sentences.english: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.chinese: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.english: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.chinese: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.english: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.chinese: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

sentences.english: The total prize money was £30,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

name: prized
trans: adj. 被看作最重要的，被看作最有价值的

name: proceed
trans: vi. 开始；继续进行；发生；行进

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: production
trans: n. 成果；产品；生产；作品

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: profit
trans: n. 利润；利益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: progress
trans: n. 进步，发展；前进

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: promise
trans: n. 许诺，允诺；希望

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: promote
trans: vi. 成为王后或其他大于卒的子

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: promotion
trans: n. 提升，[劳经] 晋升；推销，促销；促进；发扬，振兴

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: proper
trans: adj. 适当的；本身的；特有的；正派的

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: properly
trans: adv. 适当地；正确地；恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: proud
trans: adj. 自豪的；得意的；自负的

sentences.english: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
sentences.chinese: 自以为是、不愿认错的男子

sentences.english: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

name: proudly
trans: adv. 傲慢地，自负地；得意洋洋地

sentences.english: I view it as a call to action, and proudly sport it as a title.
sentences.chinese: 我却把它看作一个行为的调令，并骄傲地将它作为一个标题。

sentences.english: On the first day he went to school,the boy wore his school cap proudly.
sentences.chinese: 上学的第一天，男孩骄傲地戴上了他的校帽。

name: publish
trans: vi. 出版；发行；刊印

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: pull
trans: n. 拉，拉绳；拉力，牵引力；拖

sentences.english: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
sentences.chinese: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

sentences.english: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

name: punish
trans: vt. 惩罚；严厉对待；贪婪地吃喝

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

name: purchase
trans: n. 购买；紧握；起重装置

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: purpose
trans: n. 目的；用途；意志

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: pursue
trans: vi. 追赶；继续进行

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: put
trans: n. 掷；笨蛋；投击；怪人

sentences.english: He put the coffee on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他把咖啡放在桌上。

sentences.english: Where did you put the programmes?
sentences.chinese: 你把节目单放在哪里了？

detailed_translations.english: to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands

name: question
trans: n. 问题，疑问；询问；疑问句

sentences.english: Can I ask you a question?
sentences.chinese: 我能问你个问题吗？

sentences.english: I’m afraid I can’t answer that question.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕无法回答那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: a sentence, phrase or word that asks for information

name: quiet
trans: n. 安静；和平

sentences.english: We’ll have to be quiet so as not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 我们得安静点，免得吵醒宝宝。

sentences.english: It’s a nice car. The engine’s really quiet.
sentences.chinese: 这车真好，发动机声音很小。

sentences.english: I’ll be as quiet as a mouse (= very quiet ).
sentences.chinese: 我会像老鼠一样悄无声息的。

sentences.english: It was a Sunday, about three o’clock, and the streets were quiet.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个星期天，三点钟左右，街上一片寂静。

detailed_translations.english: not making much noise, or making no noise at all

name: quietly
trans: adv. 安静地；秘密地；平稳地

sentences.english: Rosa shut the door quietly.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎悄悄关上门。

sentences.english: ‘I’m sorry,’ she said quietly.
sentences.chinese: “对不起。”她轻声说道。

sentences.english: a quietly-spoken man (= one who always speaks quietly )
sentences.chinese: 说话轻柔的男人

detailed_translations.english: without making much noise

name: quite
trans: adv. 很；相当；完全

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: rainy
trans: adj. 下雨的；多雨的

sentences.english: a cold rainy day in October
sentences.chinese: 十月里一个寒冷的雨天

sentences.english: I hate rainy weather .
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌雨天。

sentences.english: the rainy season
sentences.chinese: 雨季

detailed_translations.english: a rainy period of time is one when it rains a lot

name: rain
trans: n. 雨；下雨；雨天；雨季

sentences.english: a night of wind and rain
sentences.chinese: 风雨交加的夜晚

sentences.english: There will be heavy rain in most parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 全国大部分地区将有大雨。

sentences.english: Outside it was still raining.
sentences.chinese: 外面仍在下雨。

detailed_translations.english: water that falls in small drops from clouds in the sky
if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky

name: raise
trans: n. 高地；上升；加薪

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: rapid
trans: n. 急流；高速交通工具，高速交通网

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rapidly
trans: adv. 迅速地；很快地；立即

sentences.english: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly and in a very short time

name: rare
trans: adj. 稀有的；稀薄的；半熟的

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: rarely
trans: adv. 很少地；难得；罕有地

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: react
trans: vi. 反应；影响；反抗；起反作用

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: reactive
trans: adj. 反应的；电抗的；反动的

sentences.english: a reactive foreign policy
sentences.chinese: 回应式的外交政策

detailed_translations.english: reacting to events or situations rather than starting or doing new things yourself

name: ready
trans: n. 现款；预备好的状态

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: realize
trans: vt. 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: reason
trans: n. 理由；理性；动机

sentences.english: She has reason to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她有理由感到内疚。

sentences.english: the human power of reason
sentences.chinese: 人类的理性

sentences.english: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

detailed_translations.english: why something happens, or why someone does something
to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

name: recently
trans: adv. 最近；新近

sentences.english: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
sentences.chinese: 他最近晋升为经理助理。

sentences.english: a recently published biography
sentences.chinese: 一部最近出版的传记

sentences.english: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
sentences.chinese: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。

sentences.english: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他出演了多部英国电影。

detailed_translations.english: not long ago

name: recent
trans: adj. 最近的；近代的

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: recognize
trans: vt. 认出，识别；承认

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: reconcile
trans: vt. 使一致；使和解；调停，调解；使顺从

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

name: record
trans: n. 档案，履历；唱片；最高纪录

sentences.english: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
sentences.chinese: 据官方记录，去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

sentences.english: His record reveals a tough streak.
sentences.chinese: 他的经历说明他个性坚强。

sentences.english: Her husband made her record every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

detailed_translations.english: information about something that is written down or stored on computer, film etc so that it can be looked at in the future
to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

name: recover
trans: n. 还原至预备姿势

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: recovery
trans: n. 恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: recycle
trans: n. 再生；再循环；重复利用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: reduce
trans: vi. 减少；缩小；归纳为

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: relevant
trans: adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: refer
trans: vt. 涉及；委托；归诸于；使…求助于

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: referenced
trans: 被引用的

name: refuse
trans: n. 垃圾；废物

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: regard
trans: n. 注意；尊重；问候；凝视

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: regret
trans: n. 遗憾；抱歉；悲叹

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: regular
trans: n. 常客；正式队员；中坚分子

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: regularly
trans: adv. 定期地；有规律地；整齐地；匀称地

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

name: rejection
trans: n. 抛弃；拒绝；被抛弃的东西；盖帽

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

name: rejective
trans: 拒绝的

name: reject
trans: n. 被弃之物或人；次品

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: relationship
trans: n. 关系；关联

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: relative
trans: n. 亲戚；相关物；[语] 关系词；亲缘植物

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relax
trans: vi. 放松，休息；松懈，松弛；变从容；休养

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: relaxation
trans: n. 放松；缓和；消遣

sentences.english: I play the piano for relaxation.
sentences.chinese: 我弹钢琴自娱。

sentences.english: Meditation allows you to enter a state of deep relaxation .
sentences.chinese: 冥想能使你进入完全放松的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a way of resting and enjoying yourself

name: release
trans: n. 释放；发布；让与

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: relief
trans: n. 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: remain
trans: n. 遗迹；剩余物，残骸

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: remind
trans: vt. 提醒；使想起

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: remote
trans: n. 远程

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: remove
trans: n. 移动；距离；搬家

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: repair
trans: n. 修理，修补；修补部位

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

name: replace
trans: vt. 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: report
trans: n. 报告；报道；成绩单

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: respectable
trans: n. 可敬的人

sentences.english: hard-working, respectable people
sentences.chinese: 勤勉可敬的人

sentences.english: a respectable family
sentences.chinese: 正经人家

sentences.english: Put a tie on - it’ll make you look more respectable.
sentences.chinese: 戴上领带，这样显得更体面。

detailed_translations.english: considered by society to be acceptable, good or correct

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: rest
trans: n. 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架

sentences.english: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你累了，我们就停下来歇一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使休息，使轻松；把…寄托于
detailed_translations.english: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架
detailed_translations.english: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

name: restorative
trans: adj. 滋补的，有助于复元的；恢复健康的

sentences.english: the restorative power of sleep
sentences.chinese: 睡眠的恢复功效

detailed_translations.english: making you feel healthier or stronger

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: result
trans: n. 结果；成绩；答案；比赛结果

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: retail
trans: n. 零售

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: retirement
trans: n. 退休，退役

sentences.english: She took early retirement (= retired at an earlier age than usual ) last year.
sentences.chinese: 她去年提前退休了。

sentences.english: Dad’s approaching retirement age .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸快到退休年龄了。

detailed_translations.english: when you stop working, usually because of your age

name: retire
trans: n. 退休；退隐；退兵信号

sentences.english: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.english: I retired late that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我睡得晚。

detailed_translations.english: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age

name: return
trans: vi. 返回；报答

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: reuse
trans: n. 重新使用，再用

sentences.english: Copper, brass, and aluminium are separated and remelted for reuse.
sentences.chinese: 铜、黄铜和铝被分门别类重新熔化以供再利用。

detailed_translations.english: Reuse is also a noun
to use something again

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；韵律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: rich
trans: adj. 富有的；肥沃的；昂贵的

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

name: rid
trans: vt. 使摆脱；使去掉

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

name: ride
trans: n. 骑；乘坐；交通工具；可供骑行的路；（乘坐汽车等的）旅行；乘骑；（乘车或骑车的）短途旅程；供乘骑的游乐设施

sentences.english: She learned to ride when she was seven.
sentences.chinese: 她七岁时学会了骑马。

sentences.english: He was riding a large grey mare.
sentences.chinese: 他骑着一匹灰色的大母马。

sentences.english: He prefers travelling on the subway to riding in a limousine.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿乘坐地铁出行而不愿乘坐豪华加长轿车。

sentences.english: She took some friends for a ride in the family car.
sentences.chinese: 她用私家车载了朋友们一程。

detailed_translations.english: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along
a trip on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle.

name: rider
trans: n. 骑手；附文；扶手

sentences.english: a horse and rider
sentences.chinese: 马匹和骑师

detailed_translations.english: an extra or more detailed piece of information that is added to an official document and changes it slightly

name: rise
trans: n. 上升；高地；增加；出现

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式；惯例；礼制

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: romantic
trans: n. 浪漫的人

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

name: romance
trans: n. 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

name: rouse
trans: n. 觉醒；奋起

sentences.english: His banging roused the neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

detailed_translations.english: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

name: row
trans: n. 行，排；划船；街道；吵闹

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: rule
trans: n. 统治；规则

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

name: rumor
trans: n. 谣言；传闻

sentences.english: The rumor rocked the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 谣言使整个城市惊慌不安。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

name: run
trans: n. 奔跑；赛跑；趋向；奔跑的路程

sentences.english: For a while, she ran a restaurant in Boston.
sentences.chinese: 有一段时间她在波士顿开餐馆。

sentences.english: Many people don’t care who runs the country.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不在乎由谁统治国家。

sentences.english: Courses are currently being run in London and Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 目前伦敦和爱丁堡两地都开设了这些课程。

sentences.english: Many people belong to a pension scheme run by their employers.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参加了由雇主管理的养老金计划。

sentences.english: a state-run (= controlled by the government ) television station
sentences.chinese: 国营电视台

detailed_translations.english: to organize or be in charge of an activity, business, organization, or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔跑；赛跑；趋向；奔跑的路程
detailed_translations.english: to be very busy and continuously rushing about

name: rush
trans: n. 冲进；匆促；急流；灯心草

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: sample
trans: n. 样品；样本；例子

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。
